1.content:
Normally, you would never enter the basement, especially when your mom and dad were busy with an experiment, but the man on the telephone was insistent to talk with dad. Your sister was not home and your mom was with dad, testing his latest machine. You could hear what sounded like a heavy wind beyond the reinforced steel door and swallowed hard, you could only imagine what he was working on. With your heart in your throat, you hit the buzzer but no one answered. You buzzed again and knocked.

"Dad, phone!" you called.

Again, no answer came and you became very worried. "Something is wrong!" you whispered, nervously rubbing one arm. "Mom or dad always answer when we buzz."

Shaking, you hit the access code to unlock the door and moved to push it open. Only to your surprise, the door violently flew open and ripped off, nearly taking it with you. Fortunately, you managed to catch yourself on the railing at the top of the stairs, going down into the basement, which was as big as your spacious house. Near the far wall you saw a two massive metal rings, standing up inside a pair of supports, spinning in opposite directions with a bright energy field in the center. You looked around for your mom and dad and found them standing at a complex control panel.

"The energy portal has reversed itself!" yelled mom, over the noise of the machine. "Shut it down before we're pulled in!"

"Something on the other side is feeding the machine, keeping the field up!" dad yelled back. "I can not shut it down, we have to manually hit the brake before it gets too strong!"

"Where is the manual brake!?!" yelled mom.

Dad paused. "On the secondary control panel, in front of the machine!"

Mom slapped him in the back of the head. "You idiot!!"

You saw the two rings speeding up, gaining strength and you tried to yell a warning to mom and dad but your small voice would not reach them over the sound of the machine. Then, the pull from the machine suddenly increased and you were ripped off of the railing. you let out a blood chilling scream as you passed over them and dad caught your hand, just in time, only his hand was slipping.

"DAD!!" you screamed, panicked and crying. "Dad, don't let go!! Please don't let go!!"

"I got you, son!" dad yelled back, desperately trying to hold onto you. "I got you!"

Then, your hand slipped from his grasp and you screamed at the top of your lungs as you were pulled towards the portal. You managed to grab a long handle near another control panel, but it pulled forward and snapped off. Your scream was cut short as you were violently thrown into the portal, just before the manual brake engaged, shutting down the machine.

Unknown to you, on the other side, an identical machine was running but with a large glass cage attached to it to contain whatever it brought in from the other side. A man and woman at the controls both smiled as various debris piled into the chamber, creating a thick cloud of dust. then, the man frowned as an alarm went off on his control panel.

"Honey, the computer is detecting a life sign!" he said, sounding worried.

The woman stood up, her face turning pale. "We picked up a creature from the other side?" she asked, shocked.

Inside the glass age, you landed hard onto the wood and metal that was once pieces of furniture, computers, printers, and so on from your dad's laboratory. You were hurt, cut, bruised, and disoriented. Being thrown through the portal made you feel like you had been sucked up by a tornado and spit out into a field of barbed wire. You moaned miserably and tried to find your way back to mom and dad only you were not home any more.

"Mom! Dad!" you called weakly. "Are you okay!?! Where are you!?!"

Then, your hand pressed against the glass wall of the cage. "What!?!" you thought. "This wasn't here before!"

Outside, the woman saw your hand, then your face and turned completely white with shock as her husband rose with her, carrying the same expression. "Oh my God!" she whispered. "Its..."
1.title: The Portal.

11.content:
"Oh, God, Max, it's a baby!" said the woman, seeing a pair of tiny hands following the glass wall of the containment chamber. "We've pulled in a little baby!"

"We have to get it out of there, Natasha!" said Max. "The poor kid is probably scared of of his mind!" he paused. "I'll get into the haz-med suit."

Inside the glass chamber, you followed the glass wall with your hands, the heavy dust making it hard to breath and near impossible to see anything around you.

"Ma...(cough!)... Da...(cough!)... We... (cough! cough!)... Where ar... (COUGH!)..."

you found it hard to talk as breathing in the dust was quickly and severely making your throat raw and sore. Still, you tried as you were worried about mom and dad.

"Ma... Ma..!" you cried hoarsely, tearing up from the pain in your lungs. "Ma... Ma...!"

Then, a low hiss reached your ears and you saw the dust lift slightly as if someone had opened a door. You turned to the sound to hear someone approaching you through the thick haze. What worried you was that each step seemed to shake the ground below you.

"Who is there!?!" you wanted to say. Only, due to your extremely sore throat, what came out sounded like baby babel.

"Easy, there." said a low but kind voice. "I no hurt you."

You looked up to the voice, as you pretty much looked up to everyone, but panicked as you found a towering figure walking towards you. "Oh, shit!" you thought. "He's got to be at least fifteen feet tall!"

The man moved slowly and talked in a soothing voice but you still screamed in utter terror and blindly ran from him, tripping over the various debris, hoping to escape. To Max, you let out a baby scream and was surprised to see the infant, (you), run passed him. He tried to catch you by the collar of your shirt but it ripped off you like so many rags.

"Sorry, honey." radioed Max to Natasha. "I spooked him, he's coming your way."

Not yet knowing, or caring, that your clothing had been torn to shreds during your trip and landing, you ran out into the laboratory with no shirt and your shorts falling off you in pieces. Natasha gasped at the number of cuts and bruises on your body and did her best to catch you with out any harm.

"Easy, little one!" she said, catching you by the drawers. "Calm down!"

You paused, only for a second, as you thought you had heard mom's voice and looked up. Unfortunately, in this world, Natasha, everything, was three times larger and you screamed again, running off. Natasha kept her grip but your shorts and drawers easily tore off of you as they were nothing but strips of rags on you.

"Please stop!" called Natasha. "I won't hurt you!"

Too panicked to think you clumsily scrambled up the large stairs to find a means of escape only to find that the door to the lab was intact and closed tight. Crying and screaming, you pounded on the massive door, hoping to get it to open. "Ope...!" you sobbed, desperately, despite your burning throat. "Ope...!"

To your fortune, the door opened. Unfortunately, you were greeted by a towering version of Tonya, standing in the doorway with a very tall version of yourself standing behind her! He was just as small, compared to his sister, but a giant to you. "That... that's me!" you thought. "Where the hell am I?"

What do you do?
11.title: A baby!

111.content:
You weren't sure what was going on; all you could think of was getting out of there. Before they could stop you, you made a run for the front door. Unfortunately, Tonya grabbed you before you made it very far. Picking you up, she noticed that you were covered with deep cuts and bruises all over your body.

Looking at you, Tonya softly says, "Where did you come from, little guy?"

Carrying you back into the living room, you see Natasha walking up the stairs. Seeing her, you scream and bury yourself in Tonya's arms. Seeing your reaction to her mom, Tonya looks at her and says, "Mom, what's going on? Who is this?"

"I don't know." replied Natasha after a pause. "He... He came through the portal."

Both your alter self and Tonya looked at their mom in shock. "What were you two working on!?!" asked Eric, alarmed.

"A parallel portal." said Max, now out of the suit and looking guilty. "Your mom and I were trying to gather objects from a world, parallel to our own, from random locations to study its people." he swallowed. "We finally succeeded, a few minutes ago, only, along with a number of objects, we..."

"You pulled in a baby from another world!?!" asked Tonya, freaked out and disturbed. "What have you done!?!"

"A baby?" you thought. "They see me as a baby?"

Looking over Tonya's shoulder, you gaze into the mirror behind her. To your horror, you realize why everyone looked like giants here. The reflection you saw in the mirror wasn't your normal reflection; it was that of a 14-month-old baby. "What's going on here!?"

Before you could stop yourself, you burst into years. Seeing this, Tonya says, "Don't worry little guy, we'll get you back home."

Her maternal instincts kicking in, Natasha turns to alternate Eric and says, "Eric, go grab something to wrap this little guy in."

As alternate Eric runs off to get something to wrap you in, Natasha takes you from Tonya. After handing you over to her mom, Tonya ran off in search of something. As Natasha held you in her arms you, starting to feel better, stopped crying. Looking down at you, she says, "You must be terrified little guy; taken away from your mommy."

Meanwhile, Eric came back with a towel. "Hope this is alright."

"It's fine dear." heading to the couch, Natasha says, "Bring it over here."

Natasha placed you on the couch and proceeded to wrap you in the towel. You tried to resist, but you found yourself unable to fight them. Once you were wrapped in the towel, alternate Eric says, "What are we going to do with him?"

Picking you up, Natasha says, "We'll look after him until we can send him back."

Just then, Tonya came back into the room. Looking at her, you see she's holding a pacifier. "Maybe this'll calm him down."

"Thanks sweetie." Taking the pacifier, Natasha looks at you says, "Look what I got, little guy!!"

You tried to say, "No!! I'm not a baby!!" but all that came out was baby talk.

Seeing that, Natasha gently places the pacifier in your mouth. You tried to spit it out; but you suddenly became very relaxed and sleepy. You tried to stay awake, but you couldn't. You closed your eyes a few seconds later and fell asleep. Seeing that, Natasha says, "Poor guy must be exhausted." looking at Max, she says, "We still have baby items in the attic, let's set up the crib so this little guy can take a nap."
111.title: Try to run passed them.

choices: Your world: Mom finds the note.
1113.content:
Unknown to you, as you slept, dad feverishly worked on the manual break in your own world. It had broke below the floor panel, which was not good, still, he was trying his best to get the machine running again as quickly as possible.

"You have to fix it, Max!" screamed mom, hysterical. "Who knows where Eric ended up!"

"I am fully aware of that, Natasha!" yelled dad, sobbing. "I'm working as fast as I can!" he then thought, "He could already be dead but I dare not say that to her or Tonya."

Just then, Tonya returned home from a short shopping trip and immediately panicked as she saw the house in shambles, due to the portal pulling everything towards the basement door. She scrambled over the pile of furniture and entered the laboratory to find mom by the main control panel, crying.

"Mom, what happened!?" she asked, running to her.

"It... It's Eric!" sobbed mom, hysterical. "He... He walked in on one of our experiments!"

Tonya turned pale. "Where is he!?!"

Mom began to cry louder. "I don't know!" she wailed. "We were working on a parallel portal, trying to reach a world parallel to our own!" she coughed, choking on her tears. "Eric.... He... He... got pulled in! He could be anywhere!!"

Mom then completely broke down, screaming in tears on Tonya's shoulder while Tonya stood in shock. "I only left him alone for a few minutes!" she thought, then broke down herself, hugging her mom.

Securing the new brake into place, dad released the mechanism and quickly gathered his tools before running up to the main control panel. "I'm ready to try to bring Eric back home." he said, placing his tool box down. "Everyone, cross your fingers and pray!"

Mom and Tonya broke the hug but they were still crying as Dad then quickly worked the main controls, causing the machine to come back to life with the two rings spinning in opposite directions. He then increased the power, not wanting it to reverse on him again and watched as an energy portal appeared in the center of the two rings. "Come on, Eric!" he whispered. "The portal is open, come home!"

Inside the parallel world, Max, inside his laboratory, let out a loud gasp. "Natasha, the portal is activating on its own!"

Natasha quickly ran into basement and gasped herself as she saw the objects they had pulled in were being drawn back through the portal. "It must be someone from the baby's world!" she said. "They are trying to get him back!"

Max, having seen the deep cuts and bruises on your body, knotted his jaws in decision. He quickly took a pen and pad then wrote down the coordinates of the world on the other side before making a run for the manual brake.

"The baby is too badly hurt, Natasha!" he screamed, grabbing the handle, near the glass chamber. "A return trip now would kill him!"

Just then, the glass chamber shattered with a monstrous sound and the pieces were drawn in, through the portal as Max struggled to keep his balance against the vortex. Thinking of your mom, Natasha quickly wrote a note onto a piece of paper then folded it into a paper plane and threw it into the wind. The paper plane was instantly caught and pulled in just before Max engaged the brake, shutting down the machine.

"I am sorry, honey." Max said to Natasha. "I know the boy belongs with his real parents in his own world but I have to think of his safety above all."

Natasha nodded. "I understand." she said. "Can we send him back?"

Max nodded. "I wrote down the coordinates on a piece of paper near the control panel."

Turning pale, Natasha turned to the controls and was relieved to find that she had not used it for her note to your mom.

"I better check up on him." she said.

She then left the basement to a spare bedroom where Tonya had set up a crib from the attic. Natasha smiled gently as she looked inside it to find...

11133.content:
Back in your world; mom, dad and Tonya were sifting through the debris in the hope that you'd been brought back as well. Looking through the debris, Max looks at Natasha and says, "He's got to be here somewhere, Natty!!"

"Max, I'm scared. What if he's...what if something happened to him?"

Looking at his wife, Max says, "He's fine Natty; Eric's a strong kid."

Meanwhile, Tonya was searching through another part of the debris field. She was digging underneath a piece of frame from the isolation chamber. As she looked, she spotted a piece of paper...in the shape of a paper airplane. Picking it up, she says, "I found something!!"

Mom and Dad run over to where Tonya was. Looking at her, Mom says, "What is it?"

Unfolding the paper, Tonya says, "I-it looks like a note."

"From Eric!?" taking the paper, Mom says, "Let me see."

Reading the note, Mom suddenly goes pale and faints. "MOM!!"

While Tonya goes to help mom, Dad picks up the note. Looking at the note; it says:

Your baby is safe. We'll send him back when he's healed up.

Looking at Tonya, Dad says, "This isn't possible."

Looking up at dad, Tonya says, "What isn't possible?"

"T-the portal s-somehow turned Eric in-into a baby."

11133.title: Your world: Mom finds the note.

111331.content:
You had woken up a few minutes before Natasha walked into the room. Opening your eyes, you saw that you were in a crib. You were momentarily confused; until you remembered that you'd somehow been turned into a baby. Standing up, you looked around at your surroundings. Although in a parallel universe; you recognized that you were in the guest room.

You tried to speak, to get someone's attention, but noticed that something was in your mouth. Spotting a mirror at the other end of the crib, you crawled your way over to it. Looking in the mirror, you see a pacifier in your mouth. Not only that, but you noticed you were wearing feety pajamas.

Sitting down, you think to yourself, "What happened to me!? Why'd I turn into a baby?"

As you sat down, you felt something squishy moving against your behind. Although unable to open your pajamas, it didn't take long to realize you were wearing a diaper. "This is so embarrassing!!"

Just then you heard the door open, followed by footsteps. Looking in the direction of the footsteps, you see Natasha walking over to you. She smiled when she saw that you were awake. Standing next to the crib, she says, "Hey there sweetie. Did you have a good nap?"

"You must be hungry after what happened today." Picking you up, she says, "Tonya should be back soon; with some food for you."

Tonya had ridden down to the store to buy some baby food and fresh diapers; since you'd likely be here a while. Just then you heard the front door close; followed by Tonya saying, "I'm back!!"

With you in her arms, Natasha walked downstairs. Seeing a bag on the floor, she says, "Did you get everything?"

"Yup." looking at you, Tonya smiles and says, "Hey there cutie!!"
111331.title: You're awake (your POV)

choices: You had left a big mess.
1113311.content:
You looked at Tonya then looked down at the bag, it was, as you guessed, filled with diapers and baby food. Not knowing about your dad's attempt to bring you back or Natasha's note, you came to the conclusion that this alternate family had every intention to keep you for a while, if not forever and began to cry.

Aw, you poor little thing!" said Tonya, dabbing at your tears with a tissue. "You must be starving!"

"Let's see what you bought, dear." said Natasha. "We'll feed him now."

Tonya grabbed the bag and followed mom into the dinning room where mom sat down with you in her arms while Tonya started emptying the contents onto the table. there was a variety of different baby food combinations, all of which you were sure were nutritious for a growing baby but you were not too keen on eating them. Then came out the diapers, which you winced at. They were in a small package of twenty and had a blue flower design on them. Seeing the look you made, mom giggled, thinking that you did not like the smell of the potatoes and rice baby food she had just opened.

"I think we have a picky eater here." she said, smiling. "I had almost forgot what an adventure feeding a baby could be."

Pulling a cloth bib out of the bag, Tony giggled as well. "I did the best i could." she said. "I tried to find combinations that I thought would taste good and give the little guy the nutrients he needed."

"You did fine, Tonya." said Natasha. "Let's see if he won't eat anything."

Tonya gently tied the cloth bib around your neck then quickly ran off, returning with a clean, damp wash cloth and a plastic spoon from the kitchen. Natasha placed the wash cloth onto the table then used the spoon to scoop up a small amount of baby food. "Here comes the choo choo!" she said, before gently making train sounds.

"The 'choo choo'?" you thought, looking at your alternate mom. "Really?"

Seeing your face, Natasha giggled again and rephrased. "Open wide." she said.

With a sigh, you opened your mouth and Natasha spooned the baby food into your mouth. Realizing that you no longer had your teeth, you gummed on the baby food and was surprised by how well it tasted and swallowed it down. A small but bright smile came across your face, and Tonya giggled herself.

"I think he likes it." she said. "He's so cute!"

Natasha took the washcloth and wiped your mouth clean before bringing in a second spoonful, which you eagerly took and gummed down before swallowing. "He was starving." said Natasha. "I wonder what his name is."

You tried to answer but, being a baby, your vocal chords were not quite fully developed. Still you tried and managed to speak but it came out as, "A... Aar--"

Tonya gasped then exchanged a surprised look with her mom. "What did you say? she asked.

You took a deep breath, hoping that it would help you speak but all that came out sounded like, "A... Aaron."

Tonya and her mom gasped again. "His first word!" breathed Natasha, tearing up. "He said his name in another world!"

She then began to cry, hugging you. "I'm so sorry.... I stole this moment from your mother... I'm so sorry!"

"I... I think... Aaron's mom would forgive you as long as her baby is returned to her safely." said Tonya, trying to be supportive.

"I know, honey." replied her mom, crying. "It's just that these moments are very precious to any mother, they carry them with them for the rest of their lives."

Now regretting trying to talk as it made your alternate mom cry, you reached up and took a tear away from her eye, tearing up yourself. "Please don't cry." you thought. "I'm sorry."

Natasha looked down at you and smiled tearfully. "I'm fine... Aaron." she said. "Do... Do you want more to eat?"

You knew that nodding at her might freak her out more you just gave a low coo and reached for the baby food, causing her to giggle once more. "Okay, okay." she said. "Here it comes...."

Natasha was fed you until you turned your head away, not wanting more and she wiped your mouth clean before placing you onto the table to check your diaper. turning to Tonya, she said, "Want to learn how to change little Aaron?"

Tonya wrinkled her nose at the idea. "Do I have a choice?"

Natasha shook her head. "Not really." she replied, undoing the snaps of your baby pajamas. She gently pulled you out of your pajamas, being careful not to agitate the scratches and bruises on your body, then opened the diaper to find...

Holding you in her arms, Tonya says, "Hi cutie."

Walking back to the kitchen, Natasha says, "Our dinner will be ready in a little bit."

Heading towards the stairs, Tonya says, "Okay."

Tonya carried you upstairs to her room. Once inside, she closes the door and looks at you. "You must be confused, Aaron. Being in a world that's not your own."

Looking at Tonya, you think to yourself, "You have no idea."

Placing you on the bed, Tonya says, "But don't worry; we'll look after you until we're able to send you back."

11133111.title: It was still dry.

111331111.content:
With a full meal of baby food in you, it was not long before you began to feel sleepy. You opened your mouth wide, letting out a big yawn then smacked your lips for a few seconds before reaching up for a pillow. Tonya watched you with an amused look on her face as you struggled with the pillow for a moment before bringing a corner of it under your head.

"Are you comfy now?" giggling, Tonya asked.

You gave her a sleepy grin, not wanting to freak her out with a nod, then closed your eyes, making her giggle more as she placed a light kiss onto your forehead. "Sleep tight, Aaron." she whispered. "You are safe here."

Tonya was about to roll away to let you sleep only she froze as you began to cry. There was a pressure growing in your stomach and it hurt. You desperately wanted to burp or throw up, something to relieve that pressure but you could not and pain was still growing. "What's wrong, Aaron?" picking you up, Tonya asked. "Your diaper was dry when we checked it, we fed you enough food..." she gasped, realizing the problem. "Oh my gosh! We forgot to burp you!"

You continued to cry, your stomach feeling like it was on fire, as Tonya quickly whipped the pillow case off one of the pillows before throwing it over one shoulder. She then laid you onto that shoulder and began to gently pat your back. Within seconds, a short but loud burp echoed from your throat as a mouthful of baby food was ejected out onto the pillow case.

"That feels better." you thought. "For a moment, I thought I was going to explode."

"I bet that feels better." placing you on the bed, Tonya said. "We'll have to remember to burp you after every meal."

Just then, Natasha came into the look, looking hurt and concerned. "I heard Aaron crying." worried, she said. "I can't believe we forgot to burp him."

"It's alright, mom." carefully folding the soiled pillowcase, Tonya said. "I took care of it."

You cooed, giving a sleepy grin, then drifted off to sleep where you were. "He's such a little darling." picking you up, mom said. "It's going to be hard to send him back."

Tonya nodded in agreement. "Yeah, the little guy does grow on you quickly."

Hours later, during the night, you wake up...

111331112.content:
Sitting on the bed, looking at Tonya, you point at her computer, moving your fingers, as if to type, cooing at her. Tonya followed your pointing and giggled. "You want to play with the key board?" she asked, smiling. "Okay, come on, cutie."

She picked you up then sat down at her computer and keyed up the word processor. "This should be interesting." she thought, holding you in her lap so you could reach the keyboard. then, she said, "Okay, Aaron, type away."

You looked at the keyboard and was pleased that it was the language here was the same as your own world but you were also getting very sleepy, your meal, although a mere snack for a thirteen year old, was a feast for a baby. You hit the keys, trying to stay awake and typed the message, 'Help, Tonya. I am 13.'

Tonya looked at your message with her jaw dropping in surprise before turning to you. "If you're really thirteen, how did you become a baby!?" she asked.

You turned back to the keyboard, struggling to stay awake and typed, 'Dad experiments maybe one did it.'

Tonya read your message and became worried. "You dad experimented on you!?!" she asked.

You again turned to the keyboard, slowly losing your fight against sleep and managed to type an incomplete message before sleep took you and you passed out in her arms. Reading your message, Tonya rose a fearful hand to her mouth.

'No want t go home tired hard t think dad portal hurt help.'

How did Tonya interpret your message?
111331112.title: try to communicate

1113311121.content:
Tears falling, Tonya gently rocked your sleeping body in her arms. "You poor little thing!" she sobbed, quietly. "I can only imagine the horrors you had lived through!"

Feeling safe, in her embrace, you gave a big yawn and snuggled one of her arms, as one would a favorite teddy bear, with a tiny grin forming on your face. This made you look very cute as Tonya continued to rock you, feeling her own maternal instincts kicking in.

"I wonder where the Tonya of your world is." she whispered. then a horrible thought came to her. "Maybe there is no Tonya in his world, if his dad is experimenting on him, she's probably..."

She began to sob freely at the thought before coming to a firm decision. "I am not letting you out of my sight, Aaron." she promised you. "Not for a second!"

Minutes later, Tonya's mom knocked on her door before opening it. "Honey, it's time for dinner." she said. "Didn't you..." she stopped, seeing her daughter's tears. "What's wrong?"

"A... Aaron is a little... little older than he looks." replied Tonya, between tears, still rocking your sleeping body. "He made contact with me, via the computer..."

Natasha looked at the computer screen then rose a hand of her own to her mouth, tearing up. "Oh, dear God!" she whispered, sobbing quietly. she turned to Tonya. "Let... Let's not jump to conclusions. After Aaron gets a good rest, we'll ask him to type this message again, just to be certain its not a mistake."

Tonya nodded. "That's fine." she said, still sobbing. "But, to be certain, I'm not letting Aaron anywhere near dad or his lab, Aaron might completely freak again."

Mom nodded. "Please give him to me, I'll put him in the crib so you can get cleaned up for dinner."

"I... I don't think he wants to let go." said Tonya, giggling, despite her tears.

Natasha gently pried your arms free then took you from her daughter and slowly rocked you herself as she took you downstairs to the crib in the spare bedroom that had become your temporary nursery. "I hope you are having nothing but the sweetest of dreams, little one." she said, giving your forehead a light kiss. "I'll check up on you in a few."

With that, she placed you in the crib and walked away to the dining room to serve her family dinner. As you slept, you did dream, were they 'sweet dreams'?
1113311121.title: She thinks you were abused.

11133111211.content:
As you slept, you dreamed about your alternate mom, the warmth of her body, the gentleness of her voice and touch, the sweetness of her smile. This mom had everything you real mom had, with one exception, this mom could sing on key.
Her singing voice still relaxed you in her dreams and you later woke up, feeling refreshed but hungry. you sat up, looking around to find that it was late in the evening, hearing the clock in the other room chime one in the morning.

"How does a baby say he's hungry?" you wondered within.

You guess crying was the only thing you could do but your independent teenage mind demanded that you be a 'big boy' and make your own snack. Looking at your surroundings, you found that you could climb out of the crib with relative ease. Only, it became a more difficult task than you had first imagined, having uncoordinated arms and legs to work with.

"Think of it as a challenge." you thought to yourself. "Think of it as a challenge."

Within a few minutes, you managed to get out of the crib and waddled into the kitchen, the bulky diaper hindering your leg movements as you walked. Once inside the kitchen, you looked about, knowing that you would have to get imaginative to make yourself a snack without waking up the entire house. There was a towel on the floor, fallen from the counter and you took it up before going to the refrigerator.

"If I can loop this around the refrigerator handle, I may be able to open it and get myself some OJ." you thought.

You swung the towel, getting it to loop around the handle of the fridge on the third try and, with some effort, managed to pull the door open. The OJ you craved was, thankfully, on the first shelf and you were able to reach it. Unfortunately, your tiny body was not strong enough to hold the large bottle and it fell from your hands, onto the kitchen floor, spilling some of it as you pulled it back up right.

"Oops!" you thought. "I had better clean that up before I'm done."

You pushed the refrigerator door closed then took the towel and covered the spill before waddling into the other room to return with a sip sup from Natasha's baby bag. Trying to open it, you accidentally spilled its contents onto the floor but shrugged as the OJ mess still needed to be cleaned up anyway. Placing the open sip cup onto the floor, you lifted the OJ bottle and managed to fill the cup, spilling more onto the floor in the process.

"This is a lot harder to do with a baby's body." you thought. "My alternate mom is not going to be happy with me."

Then, your stomach growled and you felt the urge to cry for food but, still, you had your pride and you continued with your mission by pushing a step stool into place and climbed up onto the counter top where you found a clean plate in the drain and a loaf of bread in a small basket. You opened the bread, pulling out two slices, then placed them onto the plate before reaching up onto your tip toes and finding a jar of peanut butter and a jar of jelly.

"Good thing these jars are light." you thought. "Now to make myself a real snack."

Making a peanut butter and jelly sandwich, a simple task for a 13 year old, was much harder for you as a baby and you ended up getting more onto your hands and arms than on the bread. Finally, the sandwich was made and you were enjoying it until you accidentally nudged the peanut butter jar with your arm and it hit the floor with an echoing thud.

You winced, hearing someone coming and looked up, covered in peanut butter, jelly, and OJ as the lights came on to see who had walked into the room.

Who was it?
11133111211.title: Mischief at one AM.

111331112112.content:
Tonya entered the room and gasped at the mess on the floor, the counter top, and you before leaning her weight onto one foot, looking at you with an accusing eye. "If you were hungry, Aaron, all you had to do was cry for it." she said. "Look at the mess you made in here!"

You were resentful about the mess and began to tear up, your lips quivering. You wanted to apologize to her for making more work for her but all that would come out was baby talk. "Nam a goo ti gaga gaga yum yum..."

Tonya sighed, rolling her eyes. "You are going to need a bath, young man." she said.

Just then, mom walked into the kitchen, having seen that you were missing from the crib. "Where is Aaron?" she asked. then she saw the mess on the floor, the counter, and you. finally, she let out a low giggle. "I see our little guest is trying to be Mr. Independent."

"This isn't funny, mom." said Tonya. "This is going to take a while to clean up."

Hearing that, you began to cry as you really did not mean to cause any trouble. "Towy." you said, crying. "Towy."

Your hurt expression and broken way of saying 'sorry', melted Natasha's heart. "Aw, come here you little guy!" she said, grabbing a towel from a drawer. "Mummy will take care of kitchen and Tonya will get you into the tub."

"Mummy?" you thought.

"Mummy?" asked Tonya, as her mom wrapped you into the towel.

"Well, I'm not her real mom." replied Natasha, simply. "I have to refer myself as something when I talk to Aaron."

"He's not a real baby, mom." protested Tonya.

"Perhaps not." agreed Natasha, who you decided to refer to as mum. "However, we must act as he is so your father does not get any ideas in his head to try to 'restore' him with a few experiments."

You shivered at that thought, and tightly clung onto mum's arm after she picked you up. "Don't you worry, little guy." said mum, cooing you. "We won't let him do anything to you."

With that said, she handed you over to Tonya who cooed you as well. "Let's go, you little trouble maker." she teased. "I'll have you sparkling clean in no time."

"Good luck, honey." said mum, giggling. "I'll be up to help you as soon as I'm done down here."

Tonya carried you upstairs to the full bathroom, wondering why her mom told her good luck...
111331112112.title: Towy.

1113311121121.content:
Tonya carried you into the bathroom and closed the door. Placing you on the counter, Tonya turns on the water in the tub. As the tub began to fill, Tonya turns to turn and says, "Okay little guy, let's get you out of these dirty clothes."

Not wanting to make things difficult for Tonya, you cooperated as she got you out of your clothes. Looking at Tonya, you feel it would be appropriate to say you're sorry again, "I towy Toya."

"It's okay Aaron." Looking at you, Tonya says, "If you're as old as you say you are, being independent is expected."

Once you were undressed, Tonya turned off the water. Checking to make sure it wasn't too hot, she gently puts you in the tub. Sitting in the tub, you were surprised by how much energy you suddenly had. Giggling, you start splashing all over; getting Tonya soaked in the process. It looked like she was annoyed with you, but she smiled and says, "So its a splash fight you want, huh? I'm gonna get you, you little rascal!"

The two of you spent more time splashing each other, and laughing, then you did getting cleaned. As she played with you, Tonya says to herself, "So that's why mom told me good luck."

Mom came into the room a few minutes later. "I cleaned the floor the best...Hello? What do we have here?"

Her hair soaked, Tonya looks at mom and says, "We were having a little fun."

"I can see that." smiling, Mom says, "Did Aaron get clean?"

Looking at you, Tonya says, "Yeah."

Grabbing a towel, Mom says, "Lets dry him off then."


Mom and Tonya had you dried off in no time. After putting on a fresh diaper, and clean pajamas, Tonya carried you down the hall to the guest room. She was about to walk into the room, to put you in the crib, when she stopped. Looking at mom, she says, "Is it alright if Aaron sleeps with me tonight?"

"Her maternal instincts are starting." nodding, Mom says, "Sure sweetie, it's fine."

"Thanks mom." before leaving, Tonya grabbed your pacifier. "Let's go Aaron."


Walking into her room, Tonya gently places you on her bed. Making sure you weren't going anywhere, Tonya turned off the lights and climbed in next to you. She turned to face you, with a smile on her face. Looking at her, a smile forms on your face, you coo.

Pulling you closer, until your head was resting on her shoulder, Tonya says, "Sweet dreams little guy."
1113311121121.title: Baby baths are a splash!

11133111211211.content:
You woke up the next morning to a familiar sound and recognized it immediately. "It's the portal!" you thought.

Moving carefully, you tried to crawl out of bed but, being so little now, fell off and landed onto the floor with a low thump. Your thick diaper absorbed much of the impact but you still felt the urge to cry. A very low sob escaped your lips as you unsteadily rose to your feet but it was more than enough to wake up Tonya. She looked around, frantic, as you were not in the bed but gave a low sigh of relief as she saw you waddling out the door. Only her relief turned to terror as the sound of the parallel portal reached her ears.

"Oh, Arron, NO!" she cried, giving chase. "You're still too beat up!"

You gave a low squeal and a giggle as you found yourself far ahead of Tonya but you forgot about the stairs. Wanting to go home, you got onto your belly and slid down the stairs, your body bumping slightly on each step, quickly reaching the bottom, still ahead of Tonya.

"That was kind of fun." you thought. "I might do that again when I get home."

You quickly waddled towards the basement and, to your fortune, the door was open and you quickly hurried inside, hoping to finally get home, back into your teenage body. What greeted you inside, however, left you numb as you saw alternate mom and dad talking to your real mom and dad on the other side.

"Is there nothing you can do to fix it?" asked Max.

Dad shook his head, sadly. "The earthquake here damaged everything." he said. "My wife and I will have to rebuild it from scratch and will take at least a year."

"This link won't last much longer." said mom. "Please, I want to see my baby."

Before Max or Natasha could say anything, you waddled into view. "Ma ma!" you said, holding your hands out. "Daddy!"

Inside your world, Tonya, hearing you, rushed into view. "Eric!?" she asked, surprised. "Is that really you!?"

"Toya!" you yelled. "Wanna go home!"

"This is bad." whispered dad. "His mind is starting to regress."

"Can we bring him home?" asked Tonya.

Dad looked at his damaged equipment then turned to Max. "What ever you decide, sir, we will comply." said Max.

"I don't know if Eric will survive the trip if we send him back through with as damaged as our equipment is." she said, sadly. "The odds are not good."

"We have to try something!" cried Tonya. "I want my brother back!"

"Do you want him back alive or dead!?" snapped dad, angrily. "We miss Eric too but I am not going to risk his life!"

Mom, finding herself to be the deciding vote, swallowed hard and fought furiously with her emotions before turning to Max and Natasha. "Please..."
11133111211211.title: The next morning

111331112112111.content:
Mom, finding herself to be the deciding vote, swallowed hard and fought furiously with her emotions before turning to Max and Natasha. "Please take care of my baby."

Knowing how hard that decision was, Natasha looked at your mom and said, "We'll look after him, you have my word."

Realizing that you'd be trapped here for another year, you make your way to the portal. Tearing up, you reach out in an attempt to reach your family. "Wanna go home!!"

In your world, Tonya started crying, "I love you, Eric."

Entering the basement, Tonya sees you by the portal. "Aaron!! No!"

As Tonya runs up to you, your Tonya looks at her and says, "Promise me you'll keep him safe."

Picking you up, Tonya looks at her doppelganger and says, "I promise."

In tears, Mom looks at you and says, "We'll see you soon, sweetie."

"Mama!! Daddy!! Wanna go home!!"

"I know you do, Eric." Looking at you, Dad says, "But this is the only..."

Dad never finished his sentence, as an earthquake shook the house. From the other universe, you watched as your family ran for cover from falling debris. Before you knew what happened, the portal shut down. There was silence in the basement as everyone realized the gravity of the situation. Still in Tonya's arms, you look at the deactivated portal and think, "No!! T-they're alive! I know they are!"

Unable to fight your emotions, you did the only thing a 13-month baby could do...you started crying. Trying to calm you down, Tonya carried you upstairs. "It's okay Aaron. I'm sure they're safe."

While you cried in her arms, Tonya thought to herself, "Poor guy! His family's probably dead and he's stuck in another universe."

Down in the basement, holding back tears, Natasha looked at Max and said, "What are we going to do? Aaron's family is dead."

"We'll figure something out, honey." Hugging his wife, Max says, "In the mean time, let's give the little guy some space."


Meanwhile back in your home universe, your family survived the earthquake and was in the process of digging themselves out of the basement. Having made it to the stairwell, with only a few scrapes, Tonya was in tears. "I'm never going to see my brother again!!"

Despite a twisted ankle, Mom made her way to Tonya. Holding Tonya in her arms, she says, "It'll be alright sweetie, we'll get him back."
111331112112111.title: Trapped!?

1113311121121111.content:
You were so upset, coming so close to going home, only to be denied, that you lost the will to speak. That, and your mind was regressing fast, due to the stress of your current situation. Tonya looked down at you, concerned, as she carried you into what would be your room for the next year. She placed you onto the changing table and took a gentle hold of your tiny hand, looking into your eyes.

"The year will go by fast, Aaron." she told you. "Don't worry, I'll make sure dad doesn't experiment on you."

You looked up at Tonya, still hurt and grieving, as the tears began to flow and your lips quivered. It was more than you could take and you let loose with a strong cry, shaking your arms and clenching your fists. Tonya did what she could to calm you, her maternal instincts growing stronger. You finally fell asleep, suckling on a bottle of warm milk, two hours later.

"Poor little guy." said Tonya, watching you sleep. "You've been through hell, being trapped in a baby's body in another world, then seeing your real family die before your eyes." she sighed, tearing up. "Don't worry, this is your home now and I will make sure you feel safe and secure here."

"I couldn't have said it better, honey." said mum, walking into the room. "Do you think you could have Aaron sleep with you again tonight? Dad and I are going to decorate the room, make it a nursery for him."

Tonya smiled, hugging her. "I'd love to, mom." she said. "thank you."

Mum smiled. "We need to help Aaron feel that he belongs here." she said. "A new room and..." she gasped.

"What?" asked Tonya, concerned.

"I just realized something." replied mum, tearing up. "It's Christmas Eve, we didn't get Aaron anything!"

Tonya gasped, teared up as well. "The stores are still open, if we hurry..."

"You will stay here and keep Aaron and Eric out of trouble." corrected mum. "I'll go to the mall and get Aaron a few things for under the tree." she ran to the door but paused, turning back. "Make a stocking for him and hang it up, okay?"

Tonya nodded. "I will, you better get going."

Mum nodded and was out the door. Once she was gone, Eric walked into the room and smiled, looking at you, sleeping with the bottle in your small hands. "This is going to be a great Christmas." he said.

Tonya gave him a warm hug. "You said it bro."

Meanwhile, back in your world, Tonya sobbed quietly, looking at an empty chair as she and your parents ate dinner together. "Merry Christmas, Eric." she thought. "We'll come back for you, that's a promise!"
1113311121121111.title: Your new home

11133111211211111.content:
After a rough night, you woke up early the next morning. Opening your eyes, you look around and see that you're in Tonya's bedroom again. "She must be looking after me?"

Realizing you were lying on your stomach, you turn to see Tonya looking at you. Smiling, she says, "Merry Christmas, sleepy head."

Smiling, you look at Tonya and coo. "Come on kiddo." Lifting you up, Tonya walks to the bathroom, "Let's get you into a fresh diaper then it's time for presents."

Tonya carried you downstairs a short time later. You saw that everyone else was already by the tree. Seeing you, they all smile and say, "Merry Christmas Aaron!!"

Tonya gentily places you on the floor, in front of the presents, while she grabs the video camera. Walking back into the room, she says, "I want to have this all on tape."

Tonya turns on the camera and records you as you walked over to the gifts under the tree. You knew what they were, but a part of you still wanted to explore. Everyone laughed as you climbed over the gifts, with a big smile on your face. Seeing this, Natasha says, "I'm sorry his real family isn't here to see this."
11133111211211111.title: Merry Christmas Aaron!

111331112112111111.content:
Exploring a little more, you find a large present with your given name on it and turned to Natasha (mum), as if to ask her permission to open it. Everyone laughed, seeing the cute expression on your face.

"He's so cute!" thought Mum. then she said, "Go on, sweetie, you can open it."

Sporting a huge grin, you pulled on the wrapping, tearing it easily. Under the wrapping was an activity walker that was made to look like a black sports car. Seeing it, you let out an excited shriek and started clapping your hands, though you were not sure why. You immediately shrugged it off. "It's better than being stuck in that crib all day."

http://www.babyage.com/icons/localhost/p...

"That was from pops." said mum, giggling.

Max (pops) frowned. "Pops?" he asked, quietly."

Mum winced. "It just doesn't feel right, referring to ourselves as mom and dad to him yet." she whispered. then then turned back to you, smiling. "There are more presents for you under there, Aaron." she said. "Go on, go find them."

You cooed then began to crawl over and around the presents again as Tonya captured every moment, smiling as you came to a present mom had selected to be from her. Giggling, you opened the present to find that it was an indoor baby swing, only it had a cool look. You again gave a baby like shriek and clapped your hands.

http://modernurbanbaby.com/wp-content/up...

"I actually might have some fun with that." you thought, giggling. "Okay, two more presents..."

You looked around again and found a present from alternate Eric and paused. Seeing this, although he knew mum bought them all at the last minute, Eric said, "Go on, sport, we have a good idea what you like."

Uncertain you tear off the wrapping and just about fainted as you saw that it was a piano, built for a baby!

http://ep.yimg.com/ca/I/genius-babies_21...

"That's so cool!" you thought. "I love the piano!"

You again, shrieked and giggled, only you hopped up and down instead of clapping. Seeing that, everyone laughed.

"I think he really likes it." said Eric, smiling. "I've never seen him so happy."

Finally, came your present from mum. It was very small, compared to the others and you opened the wrapping, curious of what it was. Only, when you opened the box, your lips began to quiver as it was a miniature version of the parallel portal on a tiny bracelet. "Mom... Dad... sis..." you you thought, rubbing your tiny fingers against the large blue gem in the center. "I miss you so much..."

http://i24.ebayimg.com/01/i/000/a1/20/c2...

You then held the pendant close to your heart before carefully clasping it onto your wrist with a click as pops turned to Mum. "Why did you give him that?" he asked, whispering.

Mum shook her head, tearing up. "I don't want him to forget where he was from." she said. "We owe it to his family."
111331112112111111.title: Opening gifts

1113311121121111112.content:
Back in your world the mood wasn't as pleasant. Tonya was sitting by the tree, looking at your gifts. Tearing up, she looks at mom and dad, "It doesn't feel right, not having him here."

"We know, sweetie." looking at her, mom says, "But it was the only way; this way he'll be taken care of while we fix the portal."

"But, you said he was regressing." looking at dad, Tonya says, "What if he forgets we're his real family?"

"That's a possibility. But," reassuring Tonya, dad says, "We'll just have to pray that doesn't happen."

"Okay." seeing a gift for her, from you, Tonya says, "I'm not going to open that gift until my brother is back."

Mom and dad thought that was a good idea; and decided to leave the gifts from you unopened.
1113311121121111112.title: A Not So Merry Christmas

11133111211211111121.content:
It was early afternoon and Tonya had you in her room. She was on Facebook while you laid on the bed playing with a stuffed dog that you'd gotten from the entire family. Seeing Tonya on the computer, you say, "Should I twy to communicate?"

Dropping the dog on the bed, you crawl over to Tonya. Before she could stop it you were placing your hands on the keyboard, causing a jumble of letters to appear in Tonya's status. Looking at you, Tonya realizes that you wanted to communicate. Picking you up, she places you on her lap. Opening Microsoft Word; she says, "Here you go, little guy."

Due to your still regressing mind, you had a hard time typing an intelligent sentence. At first you only typed things like, "SLHGFSHGKHK!&^#^@$%^%gjwsag."

After a few minutes of that, you were getting frustrated. "What happening to me?"

You may not have fully understood what was going on, but Tonya did. Looking at the screen, she says, "Oh no, he's regressing even faster." looking at you, she says, "Come on Aaron, I know you can do it."

Gathering as much self control as you could, you managed to type, "SDLJJHDKJSKJD What happen @#SHDKHSKDH#(E&IS to me now @%#E^$^%#^$?"

"We'll keep you safe until your family comes for you. Don't worry," holding you close, she says, "I'll do a better job of protecting you than the other Tonya."

If it hadn't been for your regressed mind, you would've protested that Tonya was a good sister; but you didn't understand what this Tonya said.

Just then Eric walked into the room. Seeing you on Tonya's lap, he says, "What's up, little guy?"

Quickly closing the document so Eric wouldn't see, Tonya says, "He was just pretending to type."

"That's cute." looking at you, he says, "How would you like to go to the park, Aaron?"

The idea of getting out of the house and going to the park excited you. You start giggling and clapping, which Tonya and Eric took to mean that you liked the idea.


As it was in the 30s outside, Tonya and Eric bundled you up and placed you in your new stroller. After saying goodbye, the three of you left for the park. You had a great time at the park; smiling and giggling when they pushed you on the swings. Tonya and Eric watched as you took a few steps in the snow; before falling face first. You didn't like that very much, so you started crying.

Her maternal instincts kicking in, Tonya ran over to pick you up out of the snow. "Eric, get me the towel from the stroller!"

Eric quickly grabbed the towel and ran it over to Tonya. Tonya gently wiped the snow off your face, while you continued to cry. Once you were dried off, and stopped crying, Tonya looked at you and says, "It's okay little guy. You're all better."


The three of you went home a short time later; as your face was getting red. Walking into the family room, Tonya saw that dad had set up the swing. Placing you in the swing, she says, "Sleep tight little guy."
11133111211211111121.title: Later that day

111331112112111111211.content:
It was 7:30 in the morning, on December 28th, when Tonya walked into your room. You didn't realize it but today was an important day; Tonya and her family were going to adopt you. Walking into your room, which her parents had finished redecorating yesterday, Tonya walked over to your crib. Looking inside, she sees that you're fast asleep. "He's so cute; too bad I have to wake him up."

Bending down, Tonya gently picks you up. Unfortunately it was enough to wake you and, due to your regressed state, you started crying. Gently rocking you, Tonya says, "I'm sorry Aaron, I know its early."

It took you a few minutes to finally stop crying; after which Tonya carried you to the changing table. After getting you dressed, Tonya and you joined the others for a quick breakfast before getting in the car to drive to the state adoption agency.
111331112112111111211.title: A Few Days Later

1113311121121111112111.content:
Inside the state adoption office, Natasha was greeted by a kind young woman with long auburn hair and brown eyes who looked at you, rubbing the sleep from your eyes and smiled. "He's so cute." she thought.

"Good morning." she said, cheerfully. "May I help you?"

"We are here to see Olivia Swanson." said Max. "I called her this morning."

The woman looked down at a chart and smiled. "Oh, yes." she said. "Mrs Swanson is expecting you, please go on in."

Max thanked the woman and walked passed to Mrs Swanson's office and knocked on the door.

"It's open." came a response.

Max opened the door and entered with Natasha, Eric, and Tonya, carrying you. Olivia looked up from her desk and gave a big smile, seeing them. Olivia had been friends with the Summers family for years, in fact, she helped to construct the portal that brought you into their world.

"This is Aaron, the boy I told you about over the telephone, Olivia." said Max. "We fear his biological parents are dead, we wish to adopt him and raise him as our own."

"Fear or certain?" asked Olivia. "I can not allow you to adopt this boy if his biological parents are going to return for him, through the portal, it'll create a huge mess."

"A powerful earthquake took out their portal, Olivia." said Max. "If it's anything like my own..."

"The house would collapse first." finished Olivia. "I understand, however, there is still a chance that Aaron's family had survived the earthquake." she sighed. "I will get the paperwork moving for you to adopt Aaron as your own but if his biological family comes for him, it's your mess."

"Thank you, Olivia." said Natasha. "We will take very good care of him."

"I know you will." replied Olivia. "We will have to work out some cover story for where Aaron came from to avoid any unwanted questions." she pulled out a small stack of papers from a drawer. "Shall we get started?"

Four hours later, your new sister, Tonya, carried you out to the car where your new mom opened the door for her before kissing you on the forehead. "Welcome to the family... Aaron Summers." she said.

No longer able to understand anything that was said to you, besides your new name, you merely cooed and smiled...

"We should celebrate the newest member of our family." suggested Eric. "How about going out for lunch?"

Everyone agreed to the idea, you giving a coo and giggle made in unanimous. "It's settled, then." said your new dad, grinning. "I know the perfect place, too."

Where to?
1113311121121111112111.title: Adopted with a warning.

11133111211211111121111.content:
After putting me in my car seat, the family drove a few miles down the road to McDonalds. Holding me in her arms, Tonya walked into the restaurant. As she stepped inside, she looked at Eric and said, "Come on Eric, it's time I showed you how to change a diaper."

"Oh joy."

With Tonya and Eric walking into the bathroom with me, Max and Natasha stood in line to place their orders. Looking at Max, Natasha says, "This is going to be a good thing for them; learning responsibility by taking care of their baby brother."

"Yeah." pausing, Max says, "It might also help Eric with his self-esteem."

The orders had been placed, and made, before Eric and Tonya had changed my diaper. Placing me in a highchair, Tonya looked at...dad and said, "So when the time comes...are we going to tell Aaron the truth?"

"I've been thinking of that." Looking at dad, mom said, "It's very likely that Aaron's family is dead. Telling him the truth would only serve to traumatize him."

"But mom!" looking at mom, Eric says, "He deserves to know!"

"Don't you think I know that, Eric!" pausing, mom says, "If and when the time comes, we'll decide what to do."


Meanwhile I'd been playing with my mushed french fries; paying little attention to the conversation around me. I had no way of knowing what was going on...besides I'm only 13 months old.
11133111211211111121111.title: McDonald's.

111331112112111111211111.content:
Mom smiled seeing you happily nibbling on the mashed up french-fries, having all but forgotten the life you once had in another world. "Look at him." she said, softly. "His mind has regressed so far back, he can't even talk any more."

"Sending Aaron back now would, in all probabilities, leave him an orphan in his world." said dad. "This is the best solution, for everyone, right now." he paused, sighing. "If it turns out that his parents are alive and come back for him, we will deal with that then but, for now, let's just be a family."

Tonya and Eric nodded, not able to argue with dad's logic and began to talk about making the nursery your new bedroom, buying new clothes, and declaring the date you fell into their lives as your birthday. While this was going on with the family celebrating their newest member, a tiny part inside your mind was screaming in protest even though the rest of your mind could not understand what it was saying....

After a short lunch celebration, your new family moved on to the mall where they ran into that world's version of Bethany Lore and Trever Powers who were doing some shopping of their own. They saw Eric and Tonya and walked over, smiling. Only, as they saw you, a confused look came across their faces. "Whose the new arrival?" asked Trever.

"He's a cutie." said Bethany, kneeling down. "Hey, little guy..." you cooed and giggled as she tickled you with her finger. "Did you adopt him?"

"Yes, we did." replied Mom, smiling. "His family died in an earthquake not too long ago."

"Tough break." stated Trever. "Was he a relative or something."

"You could say that." said Tonya. "We'll explain it all later."

Trever and Bethany looked at each other, sensing a long story, then nodded, silent. "Why don't we all meet back at the house in an hour?" suggested Max. "There we will tell you the whole story."

"Sounds good." said Trever. "I can help you and Eric set up a room for the little slugger."

"We'd appreciate the help." replied dad.

"I can help in the kitchen." offered Bethany. "We can have a little party or something."

"Sounds good." said mom. "We'll see you in an hour."

Meanwhile, inside the basement of your new home, the Parallel Portal activated on its own, as it had done before, and a figure walked through!

Who was it?
111331112112111111211111.title: Continue

1113311121121111112111111.content:
As the smoke from the portal cleared, a familiar figure stepped out...Tonya! Looking around the basement, Tonya said, "Dad was right, this place is almost identical to my house."

Walking through the room, Tonya walked up the stairs and into the family room. Hoping no one was home, Tonya started looking around, "Where are you, Eric? I know you're here somewhere."


Meanwhile you and the family were on the way home, having finished at the mall. Looking back at you, dozing in the car seat, Mom said, "He looks so peaceful."

Sitting next to me, Tonya said, "I wonder if any part of the 'old' him is left?"

"I hope not; for his sake." turning into the driveway, Dad said, "That'd be torture for him; having even a tiny part of his old mind in the body of a toddler."

Getting out of the car, Tonya unbuckled your car seat and said, "I'm going to put him down for a nap."


Meanwhile, unknown to everyone else, the 'other' Tonya was searching the 2nd floor for clues. She was going through Tonya's room, admiring the similarities between the two of them, when she heard the front door open. Panicking, she ran out of the room and headed towards the stairs. Turning the corner, Tonya found herself face to face with...herself.


Tonya didn't expect to see herself standing at the top of the stairs. "This isn't possible. The...the portal on the other end was destroyed."

"I don't think so." pausing, her...doppelganger said, "Where's Eric??

"He's right here." said Tonya, holding you. "Only there's two problems. One, its not safe for him to travel through the portal and two, we fear his mind has completely regressed." she swallowed hard. "I doubt he remembers you."

Alt. Tonya's eyes widened, looking at you, sleeping in Tonya's arms. "Impossible, it's as if he never aged!" she shook her head. "Please, I know that this might sound impossible but there was an accident in my world, twelve years ago that sent my brother through a parallel portal my parents were working on...."

Tonya turned pale. "Twelve years ago!?" she asked, interrupting. "That's impossible! Aaron has only been with us for a few weeks!" she winced. sighed. "We just adopted him into our family... we feared that you were all dead or would be unable to ever return due to an earthquake."

"Earthquake?" asked Alt Tonya. "What are you talking about?"

It was then Tonya made the realization. "You're not Aaron's sister!" she breathed.

With that, Tonya ran back down the stairs with Alt. Tonya after her. "Please!" she pleaded, giving chase. "Where is my little brother!? There is not much time!"

Mom and dad, with Eric, came into view as Tonya ran behind mom. "That's not Aaron's sister!" she said, quickly. "She's come for Eric!"

"Me!?" asked Eric, surprised. "I was born here!"

Mom and Dad turned to each other, concerned then dad took out a small device and pointed it at Alt. Tonya, which immediately beeped. "We feared this day might come." said dad with a sigh. he turned to Eric. "Say hello to your biological sister, Tonya."

Eric took a step back, stunned. "Say what!?!" he screamed.

Mom sighed, tearfully. "Twelve years ago, while we were first developing the parallel portal, our Eric passed away in his crib due to Sudden Infant Death Syndrome." she explained. "You, Tonya, were too young to remember this but I cried for days, praying for a miracle to bring my boy back to me."

"That miracle came two weeks later when we activated the teleporter device that now exists inside the parallel portal." said dad, taking over the story. "We had just turned it on when we saw a shape forming. the teleporter was receiving someone from a place unknown as we had no instruments to track the signal."

"Only, you were very small and frail." added dad. "We fear that, due to some incompatibility in the power systems, you lost some of your mass when you arrived."

Tonya gasped. "That would explain why Aaron appeared here an infant!" she said, waking you up. "The two portals were slightly incompatible and caused a change!"

"So, I went through the same thing Aaron is going through right now?" asked Eric. mom and dad nodded. "Oy vay!"

"It took my family years to track you down, Eric." said Alt. Tonya, crying. "Please believe me, we never gave up looking for you, trying to bring you back home!"

Eric began to tear up. "I feel at home here." he said.

Mom sighed. "For twelve years, we raised Eric as our own, Tonya." she said. "I know this hard for you to hear but, he's our son now... be happy you found, safe and happy."

111331112112111111211111111.content:
Looking at mom, Alt-Tonya said, "But he's MY brother! My family wants him back!"

"I can understand that, Tonya. But," pausing, Mom said, "Try seeing this from our perspective. We raised Eric as our son for 12 years; he's as much a member of this family as he is yours."

"So what you're saying is, you won't let me take him back?"

Dad, nodding, said, "No, I'm afraid..."

Interrupting, Eric said, "I want to go back."

Everyone looked at Eric, in shock. Catching her breath, Mom said, "What?"

"Like you said, I'm a member of their family as well." pausing, Eric said, "I...I'd like to go back, just to let them know I'm alright."

20 minutes later, having giving you a bottle, Tonya walked back into the family to see Alt-Tonya still talking with her parents. Getting up, Alt-Tonya walked over and said, "Can I hold Aaron?"

"Then you'll come back, right?"

It wasn't long before everyone found themselves down in the basement, as Dad turned on the portal. As the portal engaged, Dad looked at Alt-Tonya and said, "Remember our deal, he comes back in 3 days."

"I promise to bring him back...dad."

"Well I'm sure you'll have lots to talk about; she knows about our search for you."

Eric was about to say something when he heard footsteps coming down the stairs. Alt-Mom appeared at the bottom of the stairs and said, You took a big risk going after your brother, young lady!" angry, she said, "That portal nearly blew after you passed through; you could've been stranded."

"What!? You mean I'm stranded here!?"

"For the time being." looking at Alt-Tonya, Alt-Mom said, "What if you took the wrong Eric!?"

"He's the right Eric, mom. His 'father' scanned me; showing that Eric and I are from the same universe."

"Okay then, but you're still grounded young lady." looking at Eric, Alt-Mom said, "Welcome home, sweetie."


Meanwhile, back in your new home, the room was filled sparks and smoke. Between blaring alarms, and your crying, Mom and dad were having a hard time concentrating. "What happened!?"

"I don't know, honey." pausing, Dad said, "The portal's circuits were fried the moment Tonya and Eric stepped through."

"Can we get Eric back?"

Walking over, carrying you in her arms, Tonya said, "I'm taking Eric upstairs; this smokes not good for him."

While Tonya carried you upstairs, Mom broke down in tears. "I lost my son...again!!"

The two rings slowed to a stop as he watched the image of his family vanish from sight. "I... I made it!" he said, a tearful laugh escaping his lips. "I'm finally free!"

"I know her name is Tonya but Aaron doesn't seem to fit me." you sighed, frustrated. "It's so hard to think, let alone talk. Maybe... body language?"

"Don't worry, son." he told you. "Once your vocal chords are out, you will not no longer be able to disturb your family's rest as I continue on with my experiments." he chuckled. "Of course, you will not be able to talk at all but that is the price for advancing science."

"It's okay, Aaron." said Natasha, quietly, carefully taking you into her arms. "I'll make that bad dream go away."

Feeling the warmth of your alternate mother's body, you quickly fell into a relaxed state as you slowly opened your eyes to see Natasha's smiling face. "There you are." she said, smiling. "No more bad dream."

12.content:
The man and a woman quickly ran over to the small glass chamber as they curiously glanced over at the being, which had tumbled its way through the portal.

“It’s human! It’s a boy! Quick! Turn the machine off! Now!” Natasha shouted at Max. Natasha was the main scientist in the couple and Max was more like the assistant. Natasha had been working on the machine for years and this had been the first time that she had ever been able to get something or someone to travel through the machine from another world. “Look at him! A boy! Why… He seems a little small, doesn’t he?”

Inside of the glass chamber, you groggily shake your head and blink your eyes. You’re still a bit dizzy from spinning through the portal. It was as if you had been sucked into a whirlpool or something, and you had completely lost your sense of direction. You finally place both hands up against the thick glass wall, as you slowly get back on your feet. You’re only wearing sandals, a pair of shorts and a tank top, since you had been at home that afternoon when you were pulled into the machine and sucked through the portal.

“Look at him, Max! What a cute boy!” Natasha grinned. “I wonder how old he is?

As you finally get on both feet, you look at her and at the man, who both resemble your parents. You recognize them, but they don’t seem to recognize you. As you look around, the rest of the basement seems just about the same: There are many other devices, control panels, scientific instruments and other lab objects located in the large room, which was lit with huge halogen lamps which were hanging from the ceiling overhead. There were also dozens of large scientific charts and graphs pinned to the walls. Yes, everything did look familiar. You almost felt like you were at home. Still, something was off. Something felt weird.

The main door opened and someone walked in.

“Mom? Dad?”

A young girl, who had the same facial features as you walked in and curiously stood next to your mother as she stared at you.

“Erica! Look! We had tested the portal-transmission machine, and it had pulled this young man through the portal!” Natasha explained. “Look at him! He has your eyes!”

“Wow! He’s a little taller than me! But, he looks just like me!” she said.

A little taller?

I noticed that my sandals were beginning to get a bit tight on my feet, and my tank was starting to feel a little tighter as well. What was going on?

“That’s strange. Honey! Come over here!” Natasha said to Max, who had walked off to check some readings on the computer screen. “Come and take a look at the boy!”

“Natasha! The computer just alerted me that the properties of the object, which had traveled through the portal, had changed!” Max shouted back.

“What had changed?” Natasha said, as she walked over to the computer console.

Meanwhile, I felt like my clothes were getting increasingly tight on my body. My sandals were killing me, so I quickly kicked them off my feet. Luckily, I was wearing underwear that mom had just bought for me, so they were a little big on me. But, my tank top was starting to feel much too small on me, as the bottom of my tank top felt like it was crawling up my torso from my waist to the point where my belly button started to show! I felt like I was growing!

“According to the computer, the object has changed in size!” Max said. “Look!”

“What? You mean… The boy’s growing?” Natasha wondered.

Max and Natasha quickly turned around and ran back to the glass containment chamber, where they saw me standing there with my hands pressing against the glass. Indeed, the chamber began to shrink for me. I think it was only about six feet high, and I was about four feet tall when I got sucked into it, but I had probably grown a foot by now. My legs were longer, my arms were thicker, my feet were bigger and so were my hands. My head had also grown and I felt that my body was still growing! Was this due to the journey through the portal?

“How big is he going to get?” Natasha wondered out loud.

I could tell that I was now almost the same height as Natasha and that it wouldn’t take long or I would also pass Max, if I would continue growing at this pace. I had already passed Erica, and it seemed like there was just no stopping! My main concern now was that I really didn’t know what would happen to me if I were to become too big for the glass chamber that I was being held in! As I looked up, I could see that my head was quickly reaching the ceiling of the chamber! Oh no!

“Honey! He’s almost as tall as they chamber!” Natasha shouted. “What are we going to do?”

“All we can do is hope that he stops growing… Very soon!” Max replied. “Quick! Let me check his properties on the computer!”

Natasha and Max ran back to the computer console, which was on the other side of the room, while Erica remained standing in front of the chamber, looking at me in my predicament.

My head touched the ceiling! To make matters worse, I was still growing! I started to bend down with my knees, which became very uncomfortable after a while because my knees ended up pushing against the glass while my back was now pressing against the other side of the glass wall. I tried squatting down even further, but the chamber just didn’t allow any room! As my body continued to grow, I realized that I wasn’t just growing taller, but I was also getting wider! Everything was getting bigger: My shoulders, my hands, my feet, my arms, my head… absolutely everything!

Then, it happened.

A crack started to form at the section of glass where my knees were pushing against it. Just at that moment, I realized my growth seemed to slow down, but it didn’t happen soon enough, and in a way, I was happy because it was getting very uncomfortable sitting in that position in that glass chamber which was quickly becoming too small for me!

The crack in the glass became bigger and bigger, until the entire front side of the chamber broke and glass shattered all over the lab floor in front of me!

CRACK!!

“EEEEKK” Erica shrieked, as she saw the glass break right before her eyes. Of course, I couldn’t wait to get out of the chamber so I could stretch to my full height. Not only that, but my shirt and my shorts were just killing me!

As I walked out, I gently stepped away from the broken glass as Max and Natasha came running over.

“Oh… My… God… The boy… He’s a… A giant!” Natasha gasped, as she looked up to me.

I just stood there, looking down at the three of them, which was easy since I was now standing about 7 feet tall. As I took a deep breath, there was a loud RIP… My tank top had torn in half. I desperately needed bigger clothes now. I was the size of a professional basketball player!

I was amazed that the rest of the house and the lab looked just like my own house and lab in my own parallel world, so everything else seemed pretty much familiar to me and I was able to find my way around.

It was almost as if I was still in my own world and I had never left.

When we arrived at the mall, I couldn’t help but laugh when I realized truly how much I had grown during the journey through the portal. When we entered through the glass doors and I walked in on a large crowd of shoppers, everyone stopped and stared at me.
