"Dad! It's me, Eric..."

You stopped talking when you realized your voice still sounded a little high. Turning to what was left of a nearby mirror, you were horrified to see the reflection of the reflection of a teenage girl looking back at you.

Going through the portal the first time had changed your gender and age; going back only changed your age.

Before Dad could say anything, you collapsed from the shock.
132.title: Send Me Back!!

1321.content:
You woke up slowly, finding yourself in your bed with mom, dad, and Tonya looking over you. "I am so sorry we did not believe you at first, dear." seeing you looking at her, she said. "We ran a number of tests after you passed out, it proved your identity." pausing, she added, "You must understand, you didn't look like yourself."

"I know, some weird dust changed me." rubbing your eyes, you said. "I was hoping you would have the antidote to that freaky dust so I begged the family on the other side to send me back."

"Wait a minute!" slightly excited, dad said. "You made it to the other side!?" he smiled brightly. "What was it like? Who did you meet over there, how different were they to us?"

You began to tear up until mom slapped dad on the back of the head. "Eric has been though a rough experience, Max!" scolding, she said. "We can debrief him, err, her later."

"I'm sorry, Eric. I got ahead of myself." wincing, dad said. "Getting back to the issue at hand, I'm afraid that I never made any such dust that changes one's gender. Whatever happened to you did not come from this side."

"Then... Then what changed me?" panic in your voice, you asked. "Can you change me back into a boy?"

"Without understanding what had changed you, no." seriously, dad replied. "That dust sample you sent me is made up of elements that do not exist anywhere on this Earth." gulping, he added, "I'm afraid you are stuck as a girl for life."

Hearing that, you began to cry, moving mom to hug you. "Being a girl is not so bad." soothing you, she said. "That and you gained something in return for your loss of gender."

"What's that?" still crying, you asked.

Mom pulled the covers off of you, revealing that you were wearing one of Tonya's nightgowns. That alone made you blush but the fact it fit you almost perfectly made you pause as mom said, "You're not the size of a toddler anymore."

"This... This going to take some getting used to." blushing brightly, you said. "Nothing I have will fit me."

"Nothing you have was made for a teenage girl." smiling, mom said. "We'll need to take you shopping."

"That and I will want to run a few tests." looking at you, dad said. getting a cold glance form Tonya, he quickly added, "We just want to make certain he, or rather, she is in good health."

Mom and dad then began to talk to you, almost at once, telling you all they had planned for you when Tonya got up and walked out the door. You could not help notice she seemed to feel left out....
1321.title: Waking Up

13213.content:
You watched silently as Tonya turned to leave; feeling hurt by the fact that she wasn't comforting you. Seeing that, Mom said, "Don't feel bad, sweetheart; this is something we all have to adjust to."

Sitting up in bed, you said, "I-I thought she'd be here to comfort me."

"She'll come around eventually." Sighing, Mom said, "She just lost her little brother; it's going to be hard for her to accept that."

Looking at you, from the foot of the bed, Dad said, "I guess now we have to figure out a new name for you; can't very well call you Eric anymore."

As much as you wanted to avoid a new name; you knew Dad was right. Pausing to think for a moment, you said, "How about Erin?"

"I like it." Smiling, Mom said, "As a matter of fact; that's what I wanted to call you if you'd been born a girl."


Mom and Dad stayed with you for a while; until you started to get tired. You eventually fell asleep; only to wake up a few hours later to find Tonya sitting at the foot of your bed.
13213.title: You let her leave.

132131.content:
Sitting up in bed, looking at Tonya, you said, "How long have you been sitting there?"

"Not very long; only a few minutes." Looking at you, Tonya said, "I-I...wanted to apologize for how I acted earlier; it wasn't right for me to walk out on you."

"You're my big sister; I thought you would comfort me."

"That's what I should've done." Pausing, Tonya said, "Instead I let my emotions get the better of me; and I left

"So why are you here now?"

"I came in so we could talk." Taking your hand, Tonya said, "So you would know that I'm here for you."

"Thanks." Pausing, you said, "This is going to take some getting used to."

"Tell me about it; my little brother goes through a portal and comes back as my little sister."

"I thought you always wanted to have a sister?"

Looking at you, Tonya said, "I did; but not like this."

"So, uh, what happens next?"

"After we all get used to this; Mom and dad are going to get the necessary paper work to change your identity."
132131.title: Talking With Tonya

choices: A visit from Bethany and Trevor.
1321311.content:
"So how are we doing this?" sighing, you asked. "Making me a cousin, a long lost relative?"

"It's common knowledge that dad builds new inventions and devices just not that he does this for the government." looking at me, Tonya replied. "We're going to make it known that you walked in on an experiment and got turned into a girl." giggling slightly, she added, "It's mostly true."

"I guess." giggling back, you said. you sighed. "Who would've thought being turned into a girl would add to my height?"

"Are you complaining?" surprised, Tonya asked. "Normally, in such cases, you would lose height and look more like a toddler girl than a teenager."

"No, I'm not complaining." pouting slightly, you replied. "It's just that... I don't know the first thing about being a girl and, with the way I look now, boys might..." you blushed brightly.

"I'll help you through this, Erin." seriously, Tonya said. "First, the paperwork and then some shopping, you are going to need some clothing and a new bedroom."

You gulped, hearing this, then sighed. "I'm not exactly a fashion expert, Tonya." blushing more, you said. "Can you help me pick out a few things?" pausing you added, "Just don't make me completely girlie."

Tonya giggled. "I'll try not to." she said.
1321311.title: Continue

134.content:
"How... How can I be a girl!?!" you asked, freaking out. ""I was a boy when I was pulled through my dad's crazy invention and out through yours!"

"Don't panic." said Natasha, calmly. "I'm sure there is a rational explanation." she paused. "Did you say that your dad had built a device like our own?"

"My... My dad did." you replied, still freaked out. you then quickly explained the events that led to you being pulled through into another world, finishing by saying, "I started feeling weird weird after breathing in all of this dust, hard not to."

Natasha looked around, thinking. "Perhaps it was this dust that changed you." she suggested. "I'll get a few samples and have my husband, Max, study it, maybe he can find a way to reverse the effects... err."

"Eric." you said. "Eric Summers. What do I do in the mean time?"

"Well, I don't suggest you return until we can at least patch you up, Eric." replied Natasha. "For now, all I can do is open my home to you until we can safely return you home." she smiled. "Would you like to meet the rest of the family?"

"I guess that's okay." you said. "Just don't treat me all girly, okay?"

Natasha giggled. "We'll try." she said. "Though you do look cute."

You blushed at that then followed her out of the glass chamber, into a laboratory that looked very much like your dad's back in your own world. Max, a massive man, who was sitting at the controls, rose from his seat, surprised to see a young girl who looked much like a female version of his son.

"Good Lord!" he breathed, looking at you. "Now I know what Eric would look like as a girl!"

You blushed more brightly before Natasha placed a gentle hand onto your shoulder. "Easy, Max." she said, seriously. "The chamber is flooded with a strange type of dust. Our guest, Eric, was a boy before he became into contact with it."

Max expression changed to that of curiosity and excitement. "Really!?" he asked. "I'll get a sample."

With that, he was off like a shot to gather samples from the chamber. After Natasha got out of the bio-hazard suit, she led you up the stairs to the main floor of her house where she led you to the living room.

"Being a girl is not so bad." she told you. "I'm sure my daughter, Tonya would love to help you adjust." she then looked at you serious. "I'm afraid we can't be calling you Eric here as we already have a boy here with that name and, well, you don't look like an Eric anymore."

"A new name?" you asked, trying to hide your frustration. "What do you suggest?"

Natasha thought for a moment. "How do you like... Sarah?"

"Sarah Teddie Summers." you mused, using your real middle name. "Okay, that sounds fine, for now."

Natasha smiled. "Welcome to our home, Sarah." she said. "What do you say we get you some more appropriate clothing before I help you freshen up a bit?"

A small grin touched the corners of your mouth. "Sure."
134.title: Natasha calms you down.

choices: Your alternate self also enters the room.
1341.content:
"Just make yourself at home while I nip out to the store, I'll get you some appropriate clothes" Natasha said, "And...don't worry, I won't get anything too girly for you" she laughed, cutting you off before you could say anything.

"Okay, thanks mom...er...Natasha" you replied.

"You can call me mom if you like 'Sarah', at least until we can get you sent back to your world. Natasha said, as you sat down. "In the meantime, you might want to get Tonya to help you with your hair, and she'll clean those cuts up too" Natasha added.

"Ok, I will, thanks...'mom'" you smiled warmly.

You watched as your mother, or at least this world's copy of your mom left the house, leaving you sat in a room all alone. However you weren't alone for long, as your would be sister Tonya soon came into the room. And you did a double take when you saw her. Unlike the 6' tall sister you normally had, this reality's Tonya was only about 5' 6", and quite slender, as a girl should be. And she was dressed very feminine in a pink t-shirt, denim, cut-off shorts and a pair of strappy sandals. "Er...hi, who are you?" Tonya greeted you, with a nervous smile.

"Um...." you started nervously....
1341.title: You get a makeover.

13411.content:
"My name is, or rather was, Eric summers." you said. "But I am not your Eric, I was pulled here through my and your dad's invention, a parallel portal."

Tonya gasped. She had heard that her dad was working on a gateway between worlds of different realities but she did not imagine he would succeed. "You are from a parallel world!?" she asked. "How did you get to be a girl?"

"One of my dad's other inventions got pulled in with me." you explained. "Some kind of gender bending dust, I really don't know what he works on in his lab. My sister, Tonya, usually keeps me at a safe distance away from the basement."

You then quickly explained how you came to be in your alternate sister's world, finishing by saying, "Your mom won't risk sending me back until I heal up a little from the trip here so she gave me the name of Sarah and asked me to wait while she stepped out to buy me some clothes."

Tonya smiled, giving you a warm hug. "In that case, welcome to our world, noble young traveler." she said, releasing you. "If you like, I can give you some pointers on how to be a girl."

"Thank you." you replied, blushing. "People always mistook me for a young girl back at home, I always wondered what I would look like as a girl but I didn't expect to find out like this."

Tonya giggled. "My brother wonders the same thing." she told you. "Only, like your sister, I keep him well away from the basement laboratory."

Just then, you heard your own voice calling out. "Sis, who are you talking to?"

You turned to find your alternate self only he too was different from you as he was a mere three feet tall, one foot shorter than you! Seeing him made you think of a baby girl which caused you to be more thankful for your life in your own world.

"Eric, this is Sarah." said Tonya, not wanting to freak our you or her little brother. "She will be living here, with us, for a short while."

Eric gave you a strange look then shrugged his tiny shoulders. "Okay, whatever." he said. "It's time for my meds, Tonya, can you help me get them?"

"Sure, bro." replied Tonya. "Go wait for me in the kitchen, alright?"

Eric nodded, then walked off, towards the kitchen. You watched him leave, then turned to Tonya. "Meds?" you asked.

Tonya nodded. "Growth hormones." she replied. "We are hoping it will help spark a growth spurt, making him taller and better able to fend for himself."

"I see." you replied, imaging how hard it must be for him. "Here I thought I had it rough, being four feet tall."

"It's a how you look at it." replied Tonya. she grabbed a brush. "Now then, let's see what we can do about this hair..."
13411.title: Matter of perspective.

134111.content:
"There, all done!" Tonya said peppily, as she rested her hands on your slender shoulders. The two of you just stared into the dresser mirror of the bedroom you were now in, and you couldn't believe what you were seeing. "Wow...is that me?" you gasped, stroking your face.

"Sure is cutie!" Tonya winked into the mirror. "I thought you'd prefer your hair up rather than down" she said, as she gently patted the 'bun' style she had styled your long hair into.

"Got that right!" you laughed, still admiring your reflection.

You then checked the band aids and dressings Tonya had put on your many cuts and bruises, and you smiled at her gratefully. "I really can't thank you enough sis....er sorry...Tonya" you muttered, correcting yourself again.

"We can be sisters if you like" Tonya giggled at you.

"Huh, why not, at least until I get sent back to my own world" you shrugged.

"Cool, now lets get you something to eat, mom should be back soon with your new clothes" Tonya said, patting the back of the chair. You jumped out of the chair, and looked down at yourself, you were still wearing your oversized, slightly charred boy's clothes. "Don't worry," Tonya told you, "Mom has excellent taste in clothes, you'll look like a million dollars soon" she winked again.

"Lets hope so" you sighed, before following Tonya back downstairs.
134111.title: Your new look.

1341111.content:
Inside the kitchen, you found Eric patiently waiting for Tonya who gave him a quick hug then poured him a small glass of orange juice. Once Eric had it in hand, Tonya opened a cupboard out of his reach and grabbed a bottle of pills from a shelf. "Here you go, bro." she said, handing Eric a pill. "Take it down."

"Thank you." said Eric, taking the pill down with the orange juice. "Do you think these will really help me grow?"

"It's worth a try." replied Tonya. she then took the glass away and picked him up. "Time for lunch.."

With that, she placed Eric into a high chair you did not notice at first and slid a tray into the lock position before turning to you with a look of guilt on her face. "We are not treating Eric like a baby." she said. "Its just that he's too small for normal chairs, he could get hurt."

You nodded. "My mom had considered that with me but she instead optioned for a custom built booster seat." you told her. "I have a little step stool for me to get into it, I feel like I'm in a regular chair, and I can see everything that goes on at the dinning table."

"That's not a bad idea." said Tonya. "Who in your world came up with that?"

"You did, Tonya." you said, smiling.

Tonya smiled back. "Well, for now, can you stand being in a high chair? she asked.

You nodded and Tonya picked you up and placed you into a second high chair next to Eric. "A booster seat, huh?" asked Eric. "I hope they build one, this is a little embarrassing."

"I know how you feel." you replied. "What do you do for school?"

"He goes to a regular school." replied Natasha from behind.

You turned, as best you could in a high chair to find who you had decided to call momma for easier reference. She had a grin on her face, holding a number of bags in her hands. From the looks of the bags, she had bought more than just a few outfits, giving you the impression your stay was going to be a long one.

"I did not know how long you would be staying with us so I bought a few outfits, just in case." she said walking up in front of the chairs. "I have nothing against tomboys but I suggest you don't bring too much attention to yourself." she winced. "If word got out of where you are from..."

You shivered at the thought. Reporters, scam artists, police, military. "No thank you, I'd rather blend in and quietly disappear when its time to go home." you said.

Momma smiled. "I was hoping you would feel that way." she said. "I would not want you to fall behind in your education while being stuck here because of us, so..."

From one of the bags, she pulled out what you recognized as the girls' uniform from your school. The only difference was that the colors were slightly different. Seeing the uniform, you swallowed hard, blushing brightly. "You're sending me to school here!?" you asked, nervous. "I don't know anything about being a girl!"

Momma giggled. "Don't worry, Tonya and I will help you there, we have all weekend to work on that problem." she said. "Also, you will be going as a visiting relative with issues similar to Eric's."

"That means that the students will see your nervousness as normal, considering your size," said Tonya.

You start Monday of next week." said mom. "We have a lot to cover so I suggest we have some lunch and then we can get you dressed properly, okay?"

You slowly nodded, wondering how your day could get any worse....
1341111.title: "Mom" arrives back at the house.

13411111.content:
Momma took you out of the high chair then escorted you into the bathroom where she asked you to step out of your old clothing, which were almost falling off of you. Reluctantly, you stripped naked, blushing brightly in front of her as she handed you a pair of white panties, which you eager put on, not wanting to be naked any longer than necessary.

"Now then, Sarah." said momma. "You will need a training bra. "Let me help you into one."

You started to protest but momma informed you that it would ease the itching in your chest and you allowed her to help you put it on. "I never thought I'd willingly wear girl's clothing." you muttered, looking at your lingerie clad body.

Momma giggled. "I'm sure you never thought you'd end up a girl either." she said.

You giggled at that, surprised by how melodious it sounded. "No, I didn't." you replied. "what will I be wearing today?"

Momma paused. "Well, we need to get you used to skirts and fast, so you will not seem uncomfortable in your new uniform when you attend school here."

With that, she produced a short pink skirt from the back and put it on you, despite your gentle protests. After that, came a pink tank top, which she also put on me before handing me a pair of white socks. "I know that all of this is strange to you, Sarah." said momma. "I promise we will try to get you home as quickly as possible." she then winced, looking guilty. "Only, since you are going to school as a girl..."

"...the antidote to the dust that changed my gender will have to wait." you finished, trying not to cry.

"Just until you get back home." replied momma. "I'm sure your dad will have the antidote, if not, he will know how to reverse its effects."

You nodded then added, "I hope."

Minutes later, you were again strapped into the high chair with the feeding try in the locked position when you heard a familiar voice entering the room. You cringed as you saw Trever 'the tank' enter the kitchen with Bethany who both looked at you in surprise before turning to Natasha with an accusing eye. "What did you do!?" asked Trever, his voice booming. "Try to clone Eric and got a girl version of him?"

Natasha placed one hand onto her hip. "Trever Powers, you know me better than that!" she snapped.

Tonya stepped up to them and whispered, "Mom and dad finally got their parallel portal to work early this morning." she whispered, explaining. "Only they pulled in that world's version of Eric only, as far as I understand, it also pulled in one of 'his' dad's inventions, a gender changing dust. Only our Eric thinks 'Sarah' is a visiting relative..."

Trever and Bethany were stunned but they soon smiled as they then nodded turned to you. "Welcome to our neck of the woods... Sarah." giggled Bethany. "How long will you be staying?"

"I'm not sure." you replied, honestly. "At least until my injuries heal." you sighed. "I had a rough trip here."

"I can see that." said Trever, looking at the numerous bandages on your feminine body. "If its of any help, you do look very cute in that outfit."

You gave a humorless laugh to which Bethany gave you a quick hug. "We'll help you adjust." she said, releasing you. "Being a girl is not so bad."

"Wasn't she always a girl?" asked Eric, confused, hearing her.

Bethany winced then turned to Tonya, who was impatiently tapping her foot. "Sorry."

Tonya sighed, turning to Eric. "You know that mom and dad build all kinds of strange things in the basement." she said. "Well, they made what they called a parallel portal..."

Upon finished her explanation, Eric was white with mixture of horror and fascination. "I always wondered what I would look like a s a girl." he said. "Now I do."

Tonya smiled, happy that Eric was taking the news better than she had feared. "Well, we need to help her adapt to being a girl and fast." she said. "Sarah will be attending our school until we can send her back home."

"Right now, it's time for lunch." said momma, turning around with a plate of sandwiches, who's hungry?"
13411111.title: Bethany and Trevor visit.

choices: First day of school as Sarah.
134111112.content:
As you munched on a sandwich, still uncomfortable being in a high chair, ma, as I had come to call her, began to give you instructions on how to properly behave as the girl you were. "Sit up straight, please." she said. "Keep your elbows off the table and chew carefully before swallowing."

"I know all of that." you grumbled, "Any pointers on how to be a girl?"

Tonya giggled. "Keep your legs closer together so a boy can't peek at your panties." she said.

Blushing brightly, I quickly closed my legs as Bethany, Tonya and ma giggled. "Just be yourself, Sarah but bear in mind that you are a girl now." said ma. "Bend your knees when you go down to pick something up, and keep 'tissues' handy in a purse, Tonya will loan you a few to use."

"Tissues?" I asked, confused.

Tonya giggled but stopped short as Max, who insisted I call him pa, walked into the room, looking frustrated. "I'm afraid that I have some bad news." he said. everyone paused to listen. "The parallel portal won't start up again, I fear there has been a system wide short, it'll take me at least a week to find the cause."

"A week!?" you asked, alarmed.

"I'm sorry... Sarah." said pa. "There are literally thousands of circuits in that unit, I have to go through them all, one by one, to find what had happened." he sighed. "I assure you, I will get it working and return you home but, until then, you are more than welcome to live with us."

You sighed, wanting to scream. "Well, it's just a week." you said.

"A week to find the cause." corrected pa. "Depending upon that cause, it might take me months to fix."

You moaned, hearing that and began to cry. Ma took you out of the high chair and held you close in a hug, trying to sooth you. "There, there, it'll be okay, Sarah." she said. "We'll help you adapt." she then smiled. "In the mean time, you get to see what we girls go through everyday, it might help you understand us better."

"I... I guess so." you said, still crying.

"Hey, lighten up." said Trevor, trying as well. "I'll take you out jogging, make a real tomboy out of you."

You giggled. "The Trevor I know, back home, has been trying to get me to exercise to make me stronger." you said.

"Great minds think alike." said Trevor, smiling.

"Now way, you need to hang with Tonya and me at the mall after school." said Bethany. "It'll be a lot of fun."

Ma laughed. "Let's first get her ready for school then see what she is in the mood for after her first day." she said.
134111112.title: You recieve bad news.

choices: You say a little about yourself.
1341111121.content:
As Monday came, you felt uncomfortable in the short pleated skirt as you were not used to feeling a cool breeze on your new nether regions, which were still new to you as well. The blouse was comfortable, at least, but you were not used to the buttons being on the other side. As you walked with Eric into the school, he led you to the office where the secretary, Mrs Carol Stark, a short and plump young woman smiled at him and you. "Good morning, Eric." she said in a cheerful tone. "Who is your friend?"

"This is Sarah Summers." said Eric, introducing you. "She will be visiting us for the school year. The transfer papers should be on file, I was told to bring her here for her schedule."

"Let's see here." said Carol, looking through some paperwork. "Ah, yes. Sarah, you've been given the same classes as Eric because you two share a common height issue." she smiled. "I know what its like to be teased for a lack of height, try not to let anyone's taunts get to you, dear."

You managed a weak smile. "Thank you, ma'am." you said.

Carol handed you your schedule then sent you and Eric on your way to your homeroom. There, as you entered the room, all eyes turned towards you as Eric led you two seats off to the side in the front. The desks with yours and Eric's names on them were borrowed from the Kindergarten class and, as embarrassing as it seemed, they fit your small size."

As you sat down at the desk with your name on a piece of paper, you heard a low moan from behind you. "It looks like they sent us another baby to look after." said a mean voice to a number of giggles.

I winced then turned around to see a teen girl with long blond hair and blue eyes in a cheerleader uniform. She had a fine body, a little over developed for a thirteen year old. You guessed that she was a teacher's assistant. "I guess we could break out another package of diapers." the girl added to more giggles.

"I'm not a baby, Misty." said Eric, defiantly. "You've already been warned by the principal twice about taunting me." he then eyed you. "Don't even think about taunting my cousin, either."

"Aw, is the poor widdle babies gonna cry?" asked Misty, brining the class to a laughter. "Do you need you wuggy?"

You sighed, rolling your eyes. "What a bitch." you thought.

Misty looked at you with an evil grin. "You are a bit taller than Eric but I think the diapers will fit you just fine."

"Are you sure you didn't stretch them out, wearing them yourself?" you asked. to the students' silence. "Or did they just not have a uniform in your size?"

Misty turned red with anger and rose her hand to slap you but you spoke, stopping her cold. "You know nothing about me, miss thing." you warned. "For all you know, I have black belts in martial arts and you swinging your hand will result in a 'baby' kicking your ass." you turned to her smiling. "Do you feel... lucky, Misty?"

Unknown to Misty, you did know some martial arts and wrestling , taught to you by Trevor, so you could hold your own if you had to. Only you were not an official black belt, at least not yet. There was an awkward silence in the room as, even in your world, no one had ever stood up to the rich girl Misty before. Only, in your world, Trevor kept Misty clear of you.
Cursing under her breath, Misty walked back to her desk as the teacher entered the room.

"Good morning, class." she said. "For those who do not know, I am Mrs Connor. We have a new student to our class today, Miss Sarah Summers, would please step up and tell the class a little about yourself?"

Nervously, you got up from your desk and walked to the front of the class. "My name is Sarah Summers." you said in a soft but clear voice. "I am Eric's cousin from over seas...."
1341111121.title: First day of school as Sarah.

13411111211.content:
Nervously, you got up from your desk and walked to the front of the class. "My name is Sarah Summers." you said in a soft but clear voice. "I am Eric's cousin from over seas, I live in a small town much like this one with good people."

"What is the name of your town?" asked a muscular red head in the class.

"Portal." you replied. "Portal, England." it was where your father was born and figured few would know of it.

The girl nodded. "I'm Samantha Anne Manor." she said, "Sam for short. How do you like the US so far?"

"I've only been here for a few days." you replied, honestly. "I like what I see so far."

"You're a bit banged up." said another muscular girl, looking concerned. "Did you have an accident coming here?"

"Yes, I did." you replied, remembering your trip to this world. "The taxi that tool me from the airport was involved in an accident on the freeway, I walked away with a lot of minor cuts and bruises but nothing major."

"Well, I'm Grace Manor." said the girl. "If anyone gives you any grief, you come to us."

You nodded, giving a polite smile. In your world, Grace and Sam had a brother named Markus, they called themselves MSG as a joke and always looked after the little guy. Another reason Misty never tormented you where you came from.

"Thank you, Sarah. Please take your seat." said Mrs Connor. "We will begin English class with a little pop quiz."

Everyone moaned, causing Mrs Connor to giggle. "You will survive it." she said. "Put your books away."
13411111211.title: You say a little about yourself.

135.content:
Within a second, you promptly passed out right there and then on the ground.

"Well I should have expected as such" sighed Natasha. She knew she needed a young girl for what she and others had in mind but didn't think it would actually be a boy changed into a girl.

"Was it succesful?" asked another man who just came in. His name was Tyler.

"Somewhat. We pulled in a young girl as we hoped" said Natasha.

"Than, what's wrong?" asked the young man, confused as to what worried Natasha.

The airlock doors whooshed open, waking you up suddenly from what had been a deep, dreamless sleep. "Eric?" you heard Arthur ask, his voice much more pleasant than yesterday. "Are you up yet?"

Groggily, you swung your feet over the edge of the examination table, rubbing your still-sore back muscles. "I am now."

The lights flicked on and you saw Arthur's smiling face in front of you. "Hope you had a good night's rest. Sorry if I woke you."

Looking over at the digital clock on the wall, which read 9:13, you tried to smile, shaking your head. "Nah, I guess I should be up by now anyways. What's up?"

He held a stack of computer printouts in his hand. "I processed the test results this morning. Mostly good news, I'm happy to report. First off, you're completely compatible with virtually every kind of food and drink in our world. Claire's actually fixing you a big breakfast upstairs to celebrate."

"Aww," you said. "How nice of her."

Arthur smiled. "You have no signs of carrying any unknown disease or contamination, and shouldn't be susceptible to anything we have in our world. There also should be no detrimental effects on your body from our atmosphere or anything else in our air."

"That's good to hear. Though I suppose if that were the case we would've already noticed it when I fell to the floor gasping."

Chuckling, Arthur continued looking at the readouts. "Furthermore, your genome seems to match up nearly perfectly with ours, as far as the basic building blocks of your DNA that make you human are concerned. It seems pretty likely that, if we hadn't seen Earth affected by that asteroid twenty years ago, our universe would be practically identical to yours, give or take a few details." He looked up again, excitement building in his face. "It looks like we hit the jackpot when we pulled you here."

You nodded, stifling a yawn that had suddenly struck you, the effects of sleeping on a stiff table and being woken up so quickly. "Anything I should be worried about?"

"Not really." Arthur quickly flipped through the paperwork. "The only thing is..." He paused for a moment, his eyes scrunching up as he read. "Well, this is certainly peculiar."

"What is it?" You stood up and walked up next to him, trying to peak at the printouts.

"I'm surprised I didn't catch this before," he said, pointing to the paper at a table that had several large strings of numbers, seemingly meaningless (to you, anyways). "But according to the cellular decay and regeneration analysis, something about your body structure doesn't match up with how your genetic code is laid out."

Your eyes bugged in confusion. This didn't sound good. "What are you saying?"

"Well..." Arthur thought for a moment. "This might explain and confirm your claims of being thirteen instead of eight, like we first thought when we saw you and the computers initially claimed. Your DNA has the markings of a person that was originally conceived approximately fourteen years, two months, and eleven days ago. Which would make you just under thirteen and a half years old."

"That's exactly how old I am! See! I told you!" Your heart started to beat faster, excited at your story finally being corroborated. "So something happened to my body when I shifted dimensions?"

"Looks like it, but I'll have to do some more tests to find out exactly what." He looked up at you, a serious expression on his face. "The only thing is... this readout shows your body structure as currently being highly unstable. Nothing lethal, I think, but--"

"You think?!!" you exclaim, a slight sense of fear and anger now setting in. "I'm not sure if I can deal with you just thinking that I won't be killed by that...instability, or whatever."

"Calm down, Eric." Arthur tried to force a strained smile. "We'll do examinations and scans twice a day while you're here -- don't worry, nothing nearly as intense as yesterday's. If we start to detect anything harmful, we'll do everything we can to reverse it."

It wasn't much of an assurance, but it was all you had. "Okay. Fine. So...what exactly are we going to do now? What's the ultimate plan for all this?"

"Well, for starters, we need to map your entire genome in order to have something to base the adjustments we need to make to our own humanity's genetic code. That'll take a while, probably a dozen days of scanning, twice a day, like I said before."

"It'll take that long?" you asked, a disappointed look on your face. "Why not just do one more long session, like we did yesterday? I'm not jumping at the chance to do that, but if it means I can get home sooner..."

Arthur shook his head. "That works for an initial scan, to get us a starting point." He indicated the printouts, waving them in his hand. "But in order to obtain the 99.99% accuracy we need, the computer is going to have to process the information to a painstaking level of detail. For every ten minutes we scan your body and your DNA, the computer has to spend over ten hours of time comparing and analyzing what it sees. I wish there was a faster way, but the setup we have now costs over a billion dollars of government funds and private donations each year to set up and maintain, and even with ten times that amount, it would still take a while."

"Fine," you sigh, sitting back down again on the table, your shoulder's slumping. "I'm stuck in your universe for a couple of weeks. What am I going to do until then?"

Arthur patted your shoulder, and you looked up at his eyes, which had just begun to twinkle. "Well, Claire and I were just talking about that. Here's what we decided:"
1441111.title: Mostly Good News

choices: You still think its a movie shoot.
145.content:
Bruised and cut from your wild ride and rough landing, you looked through the glass to see a number of men in military uniforms, storming the laboratory. Shouts of protest from both mom and dad reached your ears and you hurried along the wall, hoping to find a door.

"What's going on!?" you asked yourself, wincing with each painful but hurried step. "Dad builds these things for the government, why would they want to shut him down!?"

Finding a door, you pushed against it but it would not budge. You banged against it and it whooshed open, allowing you to run out into the open. Seeing you come out of the glass chamber, everyone froze, including you. The men looked at you, stunned as, unknown to you, no one expected to find a living being to enter the room from the machine.

You froze as everyone, minus your mom and dad, looked like the characters from the Stargate universe television program that had aired every Saturday. It was your favorite show. "Are they shooting a movie here?" you thought. "I wish they would have told me."

Finally, you rose one hand. "Um... hi."

Max looked at you stunned. "Impossible..." he whispered.

Natasha also looked at you stunned, tears flowing from her eyes. "Eric..."

"Look I'm sorry if I wrecked something." you said, tearing up. "That thing pulled me in like a giant vacuum, you saw me get thrown in..." you paused, seeing everyone's confused looks. "Didn't you?..."

A tall man, in military fatigues, who seemed to have been in charge, pointed at you. "Get that boy into containment!" he ordered. "I'll question him later!"

Two soldiers quickly walked towards you with their guns drawn. "Just take it easy, young man." said the first man. "There's no need to panic."

"Come with us quietly." said the second man. "We won't hurt you."

Even though you struggled, the two soldiers made short work of handcuffing you. As one man carried you, protesting, towards the stairs, you heard the man in charge speak to who you thought or hoped was your mom and dad. "Do you two realize what you could have brought upon us by creating and opening your own Stargate?" he asked. "The general is going to hit the roof with you two!"

"Sergent Harris, you need to listen to me." protested Max.

Hearing Sergent Harris, you turned pale but still chuckled. "If that's a Stargate, its a bad mock up." you said. you then described exactly what a real Stargate looked like before adding, "With some modifications, it'll be a great movie prop but you should really tone down its power. I mean, talk about over kill..."

Everyone in the room paled but the man in charge quickly recovered and turned to you. "Son, I don't think you realize the true seriousness of your situation."

How do you respond?
145.title: 13 your normal age.

1452.content:
Your face turned red with impatience. "Then why don't you explain the situation to me, Sergent." you demanded, politely, the soldier still holding you firm. "Stargate is nothing more than a television series where I come from."

"That's just it, young man, you are not where you come from." said Harris patiently. "You said you were pulled into the machine and then spit out?" you nodded. "That would have been impossible with the transparent aluminum room covering the gate opening. Was there such a room there when you were pulled in?"

You swallowed hard, realizing Harris was right. "No, there wasn't." you replied. "My mom and dad were trying to shut the machine down when I entered the lab, something was keeping it running, pulling everything in that was not secured."

Harris nodded. "That would be because, it was linked with this world." said Harris, his face softening slightly. "Like it or not, you are stuck here, for now."

"Why can't you just send me home?" you demanded more softly. "Its not like I wanted to come here."

"Sorry, we can't take that chance." said Harris, quickly. "This lab and everything within it must be shut down until we run a full investigation. As for you..."

"What about me, I'm a victim in all of this!" you protested. "I just want to go home!"

"You were pulled in by accident... Eric." said Max, also being placed in handcuffs. "I'm very sorry but we have no way of knowing which world you came from, sending you back might place you in a worse situation."

You turned pale, realizing that you were truly stranded and began to tear up. "What will become of me?" you asked.

Harris sighed. "If our world is nothing more than a television series in your reality, your knowledge may prove invaluable to us in defending our home world." he explained. "You will be taken to Home world Command headquarters where you will be detained and questioned. If your information proves legit, you might be put on the team."

With that, Harris gave the soldier a nod and he hit you on the back of the neck, sending you into darkness. When you woke up, you found yourself...
1452.title: You demand answers.

14521.content:
You find yourself in a jail cell. It's the bare minimum, just like you've seen in movies. You're lying on a cot bed that's been pulled down from the wall, only a blanket to cover you. A thin one at that. In the far corner there's a metallic toilet with no seat. You look at it with disgust hoping you don't have to use it.

You sit up trying to get your bearings. The front of the cell contains an iron door, closed and locked, a small hatch at the bottom which allowed them to feed you and talk to you.

As if on cue the hatch opens and a tray is shoved through. It contains a carton of juice and a plate of something you can't recognise. You're not hungry and leave it where it is.

You spend the next few hours brooding on your situation, reminding yourself you're somewhere different. You're not at home anymore. We're not in Kansas anymore. You can only hope that things will have a good ending.

Just then the jail cell door is unlocked. A burly man in a uniform handcuffs you and tells you to follow him for...
14521.title: In a jail cell.

14522.content:
You woke up hours later with your entire body aching to find yourself lying under the covers of a single bed in a comfortable bedroom setting. Rubbing the back of your head, you pulled the covers off yourself to find that you were wearing clothing suited for a toddler. A moan escaped your lips as your clothes back home were specially made in styles for a teenager. "I hate wearing this stuff." you muttered, "It makes me feel like a baby."

Pushing yourself off the bed, you walked over to the door, you guessed was the way out. Only the door was locked tight and you noticed a card lock on the wall a little higher up. Looking around, you saw no windows and the only other door lead to a small washroom with a toilet, sink, and shower. "I've been kidnapped." you said, angrily. "Why did I have to answer that phone today!? Even working out with Trevor is better than this."

Just then, the door beeped and you turned to see a middle aged man enter with a small tray of wrapped sandwiches and two large cups of what smelled like hot chocolate. He placed the tray down and sighed, looking at me.

"I'm Major Paul Davis of Homeworld Command." he said, tiredly. "The good news is that the doctors gave us the okay to feed you our food, they examined you while you were out cold." he motioned to the tray. "Sorry its not much, I had to raid the vending machines but its better than nothing and its not half bad."

You looked at the tray but did not move, even though you were starving. "Kidnapping is a crime and so is assault, Major Davis." you blurted out. "Where am I and why are you holding me here!?"

"Easy, now!" scolded the man, looking stern. "First, we had no idea what our sedatives would do to you so a blow to the head was necessary to pacify you. Second, be thankful we detected the opening of the portal before the Lucian Alliance. Third, you are being detained at homeworld command as you may have invaluable information we can use."

You sighed, your anger fading. "Sorry, I'm having a bad day."

Davis nodded. "I've had those myself." he said, sitting down. "Let's start with getting some breakfast in and then I want to ask you some questions regarding your knowledge of Stargate."

As you and Davis shared the cold sandwiches and hot chocolate from the vending machines, you told Davis about the movie that had launched the number of television series. Davis listened carefully and jotted down notes as he asked the occasional question, which you answered.

"So now." said Davis. "Tell me about the Lucian Alliance, as you know it from your television series."

You took a breath. "After the Goa'uld regime went down, much of their resources and technology fell into the hands of the humans they had controlled. Some of these guys banded together and formed the Lucian Alliance, an organization very similar to the Mafia but on a galactic scale. Although humans mostly run the show, the Alliance also has members from other races, including Oranians." you began. "This group is formidable, as I'm sure you've learned from experience but its not not without its weaknesses. The Alliance is largely controlled by mercenaries, smugglers, and other criminals, its leadership is touchy at best, with a lot of conflict at the top. Members live dangerous lives, being killed for the slightest offense or simply when a rival desires their territory.The Alliance rules with fear and intimidation, and punish defiance with swift retribution... this makes them a lot like the Goa'uld."

Davis nodded, taking down notes. "Any idea who their leader is right now?" he asked.

"If I remember right, its a guy named Netan." you replied. "Don't quote me on that, though."

Davis grunted. "anything else you can tell us?" he asked.

"Well, they're headed by a single leader, who divides responsibility, territory, and resources among his 'sconds'." you replied, thinking. "About 20 of these guys take care of things like smuggling, extortion, racketeering, and trafficking in kassa, a corn-like grain that's addictive." you paused. "That's what they use to keep their pee-ons in line."

"Interesting." said Davis, jotting down more notes. "Go on."

"The Alliance has quite an armada of Goa'uld vessels, including Ha'taks, Al'kesh bombers, Death Gliders, and Tel'taks." you continued. "They have spies everywhere. Don't underestimate them, major, they are a credible threat, especially to the Tau'ri and the newly formed Jaffa government."

Davis sighed. "Some of this we already knew but this kassa you speak of, that explains a lot." he said. "I'll let you rest while I make my report." he gave you a smile. "Welcome to our world."

With that, he walked to the door and swiped a card. The door buzzed and opened, allowing him to walk out. "Wait." you said, walking to him. "Don't I get a tour or something?"

Davis roughed up your hair. "I'll see what I can do." he said.

He then walked out, closing the door, sealing you inside. You huffed before walking back to your hot chocolate. "I'll see what I can do." you said, mockingly. you took a sip. "This is good."

Hours later...
14522.title: A comfortable prison.

145221.content:
Hours of nothing to do later, the door buzzed again and a man, wearing a dress military uniform entered with thick folder in his hand, closing the door behind him. "Hi there." he said. "I'm general Johnathan O'Neil, head of homeworld command."

"It's about time someone came back." you said, annoyed. "I've been going crazy, sitting in here for hours with nothing to do and no one to talk to. Am I guest or a prisoner?" you sighed. "Did you at least bring me something to read?"

"Yeah... sorry about that." said O'Neil. "I'll make sure you get plenty of things to keep you occupied." he then sat down and pushed the folder towards you. "This is all of the information we have on the Lucian Alliance." he continued. "Some of what you had said, we already knew but a large part of it has us worried. What can you tell us about this Netan?"

You opened the folder and found a picture, paper clipped to a report. It was the man you knew from the series as the leader of the Lucian Alliance. "That's him." you said, pointing at the picture. "That's Netan."

"What can you tell me about him?" asked O'Neil. "Anything you can remember would be helpful."

"He's ruthless, that much I know for certain." you said. "He knows you guys by reputation, when your team investigates his kassa smuggling operation, you will be drawn into Ba'al's scheme to steal stargates from across the galaxy." you paused. "At least that's how it went in the television series."

O'Neil grunted. "Thus far this 'television show' matches our world perfectly." he said. "Only, who is this Ba'al? What can you tell me about him?"

You took a breath. "In the series I know, Ba'al was a Goa'uld, and one of the last System Lords. He had left Ra's service to become a ruler himself elsewhere." you began. "After the Goa'uld fell to the Replicators, he became the only known surviving System Lord and was determined to rebuild his empire and his return to power."

"Go on." urged O'Neil, writing something down on a pocket notepad.

You sighed. "Ba'al succeeded, somewhat, with a number of clones but those copies were killed with the 'last' being extracted by the Tok'ra." you said. "The real Ba'al was finally killed by Colonel Cameron Mitchell who set a nasty ambush for him when he tried to change time. Ba'al never returned to the series after that."

"Wait, you stressed the word last when you spoke of Ba'ad's clones being killed." said O'Neil.

You nodded. "The series hinted that one of his clones had survived." you replied.

O'Neil sighed. "The kid's a walking encyclopedia of our reality." he muttered under his breath. he then turned to you, forcing a smile. "I think you'd make a valuable member to our team, what do you say?"

"With all due respect, general." shaking your head, you said. "I just want to go home."

"I'm afraid that's not possible, Eric." said O'Neil, seriously. "The portal that brought you here is being dismantled as we speak to be studied with a fine toothed comb."

"What!?!" you screamed, standing up.

"Sit down!" yelled O'Neil, startling you.

You folded your arms in defiance. "You never had any intention to send me home!" you accused. "I'm helping you the best I can, what do you want from me!?!"

"Sit.... down!" repeated O'Neil, more slowly but also more forceful.

Grudgingly, you sat down as O'Neil took a breath to calm himself. "Look, Eric, does your world have anything to match the technology of our world?"

That question took you off guard and you slowly shook your head. "No... we haven't even met our first alien yet."

O'Neil suppressed a short chuckle. "Suppose we kept the portal up and managed to send you back home to your world." he said. "The Lucian Alliance has shown interest in Max and Natasha's inventions, they went as far as to kidnap their son to get them on their team."

Your face paled. "This world's version of me." you said.

O'Neil nodded. "As far as we know, that Eric is dead." he said. "The point I'm making is that if the Lucian alliance gets a hold of that portal and learns how it works, they could come to your reality and take over Earth all too easily."

Hearing that, your face completely drained of any color and you began to cry. "So that's it." you said. "I'm stuck in a parallel world with no way home."

"I know how hard it is to lose a family." said O'Neil, placing a hand onto your shoulder. "We are keeping you here to protect your world, keep it safe. You can make a difference in this world by helping us keep it safe."

"Where would I live?" yo asked, still crying. "What would I do?"

O'Neil sighed. "You'll live here, at homeworld command." he said. "You're knowledge will make you dangerous to our enemies, they will try to silence you, if they ever learn of you. As for what you will do, you will be our official adviser." he gave you a more genuine smile. "What do you say, want to be a part of the team?"

Barely keeping yourself together, you finally nodded. "Okay." you said, softly. "I'm in."

With that, you completely broke down and O'Neil pulled you into a hug and began to slowly rock you. "You made the right choice, Eric." he said. "Believe me, you made he right choice."
145221.title: You get another visitor.

1452211.content:
Twenty minutes later, O'Neil, who had requested you call him 'Jack', escorted you into a private meeting room where you were greeted by, in your world, the main characters of Stargate. "Have a seat." said Jack, pulling out a chair.

You were annoyed that he had placed a number of books on the chair to boost you up but, at least, you were able to see over the table. The senior members of homeworld command turnd to you, curious.

"Sir, what's this about a kid from another universe?" asked a man you recognized as Cameron 'Cam' Mitchell.

"We found an unauthorized gate being constructed and tested." glancing at Major Davis, O'Neill said. "We managed to shut it down, but not before a kid was pulled through." he sighed. "His name is Eric Summers, his world has nothing to compare to ours, we can't take the risk of sending him back."

"We haven't dealt with another reality in a while." said Mitchell, eying you. "If his world doesn't have anything to compare to ours, why is he here?"

"There's more to this, Mitchell." pausing, Jack said. "Our reality is a TV show in his universe."

Everyone's jaws dropped, suddenly eying you. Mitchel's eyebrows rose. "He knows everything about our world?" he asked. "That can't be possible."

You sighed. "Lieutenant Colonel Cameron 'Cam' Mitchell, son of Frank and Wendy Mitchell, long-time residents of Auburn, Kansas. Mitchell occasionally mentioned his Bible-thumping grandmother in comparison and contrast to the Ori religion. Mitchell's grandfather was the captain of the ship that transported the Alpha Gate from Egypt to the United States in the late 1930s, which was deemed 'beyond classified'." you stated, causing Mitchel's jaw to drop.

"Convinced?" asked Jack.

"Wait, so he knows everything about our lives!?" asked Lt. Col. Samantha Carter, stunned.

"Not everything, Lieutenant Colonel Carter." you said. "The television series focused more on the Stargate missions than anyone's individual private lives. I have read everyone's charter biographies online but I don't remember every detail."

Samantha sighed, a look of relief coming across her face before turning to you serious. "If you are going to be on this team with me, keep anything you know about my private life to yourself, understand?"

You gulped. "Yes, ma'am." you replied, quickly.

"That goes for all of us." said Jack, equally as serious. "Our private lives are just that, private. Don't go blabbing off what you know about anyone unless it is relevant to our current mission and I or Mitchell order you to reveal it."

"Yes... I understand, sir." you said.

Jack nodded the gave you a small grin. "Lighten up, Eric." he said. "We're just covering the ground rules so we can work together as a team and do our job."

"Any information he may have of future threats would be beneficial." said Teal'c, quietly.

"He's already given us a heads up on a Goa'uld, named Ba'al." pointing to a folder in front of each team member, Jack said. "All the data is in the report."

"Ba'al was in the service of Ra." said Teal'c. "I thought he had perished years ago."

"Apparently not." replied Jack. "It seems he has made clones of himself to increase his odds of survival." he paused, looking at his team. "Sam, I'm putting you in charge of looking after Eric. It will be your responsibility to keep him safe."

"What!?!" asked Sam, standing up. "With all due respect, sir..."

"That was not a request, Lieutenant Colonel." said Jack, sternly. "You are the best suited to keep Eric safe and in line and I expect you to perform that duty to the best of your ability, is that clear?"

Sam sighed, not liking the idea of 'babysitting' at all. "Yes sir." she said.

Jack sighed himself. "Any questions?" he asked. no one responded. "Good, you are dismissed."

Everyone rose and walked out of the room with Sam taking you by the wrist. "It looks like you're bunking with me, kid." she said, irritation in her voice. "I have a few 'house rules' to go over with you, I expect you to follow them."

"Yes, ma'am." you replied quickly.

"Eric, wait outside a minute." said Jack. "I want a word with the Lieutenant Colonel."

You nodded and stepped out, closing the door. Once you were out of ear shiot, Jack turned to Sam. "I picked you to look after the kid because you are the first person he responded to immediately with no back talk or argument." he explained. "I don't know why but he seems to respect you greatly and we need him to stay cooperative."

Sam looked at Jack, surprised. "He back talked to a general?" she asked before giggling. "I must have some power."

Jack gave Sam a half smile. "He thinks we're keeping him here as a 'trump card'." he said.

"Are we?" asked Sam.

"I'll reassign you to a two bedroom dorm." said Jack, not answering the question. "You'll have to make due for tonight."

Sam walked passed Jack and left the room. "Come on, Eric." she said, taking your wrist. "I'll escort you to our quarters."

"Yes, ma'am." you replied.

"You can drop the 'ma'am' crap." irritated, Sam stated. "Just call me Sam, okay?"

"Okay... Sam." you said.

Sam sighed. "This is going to be a long night."
1452211.title: Meeting the team.

14522111.content:
"Okay, Eric, I'm not a huge fan of babysitting so I'll appreciate it if you listen and obey the rules." said Sam. "You know a lot about this world, which makes you a valuable commodity."

"Which is why they won't send me home." you said, sadly. "Me and my big mouth."

"A lesson learned, young man." said Sam with a half grin. "The first rule is never talk to anyone outside of those you met in that room without my or Mitchell's clearance."

"Yes, Sam." you said.

Sam paused, reaching a door and inserted a card. A green light came on, followed by a buzz and the door opened, allowing them to walk inside. "Rule number two, Never answer the door for anyone when you are alone, I have a key and Jack has a master key, understand?" you nodded and Sam continued stating the rules...

"Rule three: If my bedroom door is closed, do not enter before knocking unless you want the beating of your life."

"Rule four: Do not go wandering off anywhere without me at your side. There are guards here who, if they do not recognize you, will shoot first and ask questions later."

"Rule five: Even with me with you, do not enter my lab or the gate chamber. The lab is my personal space, I will slap you silly if I catch you in there. As for the gate chamber, remember the guards I mentioned?"

You gulped and nodded but did not speak as Sam continued...

"Rule six: You will follow my orders immediately and without question as I am in charge of your safety."

"Finally, rule seven: For tonight, you sleep on top of the covers while I sleep below them. When we get our own rooms, you will keep your door open at all times unless I order otherwise."

You nodded, tears forming. "Yes, Sam... I understand."

Sam sighed. "Look, I know it sucks being trapped on an 'alien' world." she said. "I live with that fear every time we go out on a mission but at least you are on a world you somewhat know and where you can make a differnece."

"I'll do the best I can, Sam." you said.

Sam smiled, roughing up your hair. "I heard you only had those nasty snacks from the vending machines to eat." she said, walking into the kitchen area. "How do you feel about left over stew?"

You shrugged. "I'll try anything once."

Sam giggled.
14522111.title: Learning Sam's 'house rules'.

145221111.content:
While you sampled Sam's stew, Max and Natasha sat, handcuffed, in a small room with only one exit and a window into another room where Jack watched them for a few minutes before entering. He placed a large folder onto the table in front of them and sat down across from them. "You two are in serious trouble right now." he said, flatly. "When you left homeworld command, you were caught with blueprints to a gate. After confiscating them, we warned you not to attempt to build your own gate system." he paused, looking at them. "What were you trying to accomplish?"

"We- We were trying to reach our dead son." said Natasha in tears. "Heaven is nothing more than another world, we were trying to reach that world."

Jack shook his head. "Do you have any idea how insane that sounds?" he asked. "Even if it were possible, you could have opened the gates to the other place, dooming us all." he then turned to Max. "Would you like to try to explain this?"

Max sighed. "We were trying to reach but a world parallel to our own, which we obviously succeeded in doing." he said. "Our goal was to find a world where our counterparts were killed in an attack on homeworld command instead of our children. It was our hope to adopt those childeren and be a family again." he paused. "We were making a test run of the gate when we accidentally locked onto a gate on the other side, we thought it to be a great success."

Jack sighed, opening the file. "Well, your great success has marooned a small boy onto our world." he said. "He says that his world has nothing in comparison to our own but he's just a kid so, there's no telling what his world is capable of."

"What will become of our portal, our research?" asked Natasha, tearfully.

"I'd be more worried about what the courts will do with you two." replied Jack, standing up. "You're no longer military but what you did is a threat to our planet, you will be facing a military court."

"What of our son..." asked Max. "Can we see him one more time?"

Jack rose to his feet, taking the file with him and opened the door. "He's not your son." he replied, coldly. "I'm sorry your children died but kidnapping a child won't bring them back."

With that, he walked out, slamming the door behind him.

"That was really good." you said, helping Sam wash dishes. "You're a pretty good cook."

"I try." replied Sam, smiling. "Mind if I ask you why you wear your hair so long, you look like a girl."

You giggled. "A lot of people mistook me for a girl, even with short hair." you explained. "I finally decided to keep my hair long and let them guess for themselves."

Sam smiled, shaking her head. "Well, you should at least style it a little. Would you like some help?"

You shrugged. "If you want."

Sam motioned you to a chair as she walked into the other room. As you sat down, she returned with a brush and comb. "I've seem many a man wearing their hair in a single ponytail." he said. "It will serve to keep the hair out of your face and make you a little more presentable."

With that, she began...
145221111.title: Max and Natasha are questioned.

1452211112.content:
Later that night, after Sarah had finished giving you a male makeover, she pointed you to a full length mirror on the wall. "Take a look at yourself." smiling, she said. "Did I make you look sharp or what?"

You looked into the mirror, surprised. Staring back at you was a boy in strange but stylish robes, you guessed them to be alien garments from one of their excursions. Your sand blond hair was tied back into a long, single ponytail, showing your gentle blue eyes which accented your new sprayed on tan very well. For once in your life, as you looked at yourself,you felt more like a boy than a girl. "Is that... me?" a smile forming, you asked. "You did a great job."

Sam giggled slightly. "It doesn't take much to make you look more masculine." smiling, she said. "All you lack is confidence in yourself. I can probably help you there."

You smiled more at that but paused as an urgent knock came to the door. "Who could that be?" curious, you asked.

"Stay where you are." drawing her sidearm, Sam said. "I'll go see." she walked to the door. "Identify yourself."

"Security." replied a deep voice. "I have been orders from O'Neal to tag the boy with a tacking device."

Sam turned the safety of her weapon to the off position then cautiously opened the door. Only, no sooner the door opened ajar, it was violently pushed open by Max as he charged in. He kicked the gun out of Sam's hand then ran straight for you! "You need to come with me!" urgently, he said. "Its our only chance to get our son back!"

"Step away from the boy!" landing a firm kick to Max's head, Sam warned. "Get out while you can still walk!"

Max responded with a powerful right hook to Sam's jaw, sending her stumbling before he then took up a chair and broke it onto her head, stunning her. "They have my son!" turning back to you, Max said. "You can help me get him back!"

As Max approached you, something in your gut told you that he was not who he claimed to be. Then, you remembered that, in one of the series, a device called the Mimetic was used by the Stragoth to mimic the outward appearance of other people, usually used in conjunction with a mimetic thought processor. This device was used to get close enough to their enemy to strike. Alarms sounded everywhere in your head as the knowledge you possessed had already begun to spread and you were a target!

Unknown to you, a sudden storm had struck outside. The wind blew forcibly as hunting sounds of thunder sounded with lightning streaking menacingly across the sky. Inside, you rose you hands in defense as 'Max' moved to grab you but a powerful force rushed through you and 'Max' was violently thrown across the room and out the door, crashing through the wall into the next room!

14522111121.content:
“S-S-Sam?” you stutter, as you stare at her body while trembling in fear following the horrific attack by the Mimetic. “Are… Are y-y-y-you alright?”

Sam slowly got to her feet. Her forehead and her cheek were swollen from the blows which she had received during the brief, but violent exchange, which had ended so sudden.

“Eric… Oh, Eric!” Sam said, as she quickly ran into the kitchen and pulled and ice-pack from the freezer. “Are you alright?”

“I’m fine… I’m just… a little… Uhh… I’m a little shaken up!” you reply, as you’re still trying to process what had happened over the past three minutes.

“But… Eric… How… HOW did you get rid of him?” Sam asked, as she walked up to you while holding an ace pack against the side of her head. “One minute, he had kicked me in the face… The next, he went flying across the room and through the wall and… Out the door!”

Both you and Sam stared at the hole in the wall as Sam closed and locked the door to the apartment.

She stopped and stared at the wall again, before she glanced over at you.

“How… How did you do THAT?”

“I… I… I don’t know! I REALLY don’t!” you say with a trembling voice. “I just wanted him to go away! I wanted him GONE! I wanted him to get OUT THE DOOR!”

Sam squatted down and looked you in the eye.

“Eric… I think this episode must have unlocked some hidden power that you possess! We must learn more about it! But… Uhhh… I got such a headache right now!” Sam groaned.

“You gotta lay down, Sam!” you suggest to her. “Your face is swollen!”

“Yes… Well, just get some rest, okay? And, don’t open the door!” Sam ordered, as she walked into her bedroom.

You sighed and turned around, feeling scared and confused. You needed some time alone. Time to think. Time to reflect .

Then you begin to think about what had happened earlier, when ‘Max’ tried to kidnap you. You tried to remember what you did. You wanted to repel the attacker. You just wanted to move the man OUT of the house! Then, you remember feeling some great, invisible force awaken from deep within you… some amazing, invisible but mighty POWER that was unleashed! Max couldn’t do ANYTHING! He was rendered totally helpless against… this unseen POWER… which came from deep within… YOU! This unseen force… was yours! It came from YOU! You realize that you needed to figure out how to summon it again!

You sat on your bed, looking around the room. You had some toys, small figurines, and a small bowl of grapes on your desk with a spoon and a fork. Sam must have left those on your desk before Max came in the house.

You wonder if you could call upon your power to levitate the porcelain bowl. You frown as you concentrate really hard on the bowl rising above the table. Nothing happens. You’re trying too hard.

You focus on the glass of water, which sat next to the bowl on the desk. You’re thirsty. Without thinking too hard, you just wish for the glass to come to you.

Then, it happened!

The glass began to rise up from the desk, and it began to float towards your hand. You held your arm stretched out! The glass just floated straight into your hand! You closed your grip, and you held the glass, without ever standing up!

“I got it! I did it!” you cheer.

You drink the water, as you gulp it down.

Then, you loosen your grip on the glass. Without concentrating very hard, the glass just hovers out of your hand, and floats back to the desk, and lands next to the bowl.

“Wait… I got it… It’s like I’m using my hands and my arms… but they’re invisible!” you chuckle.

Suddenly, you understand this new… Power! You feel this new talent working in you! You begin to master this amazing new gift! You glance at the bowl, and with no effort at all, the bowl rises up and floats towards you, stopping right by your lips.

The fork magically rises up and pierces a grape. Then, it flies out of the bowl and hover in front of your mouth, waiting for you to open wide. Lastly, the fork gently places the grape on your tongue, so you can bite down on it with your teeth. As you do so, the fork pulls out and flies back to the bowl, which is still hovering in mid-air. You take a few minutes to eat your grapes without ever using your hands.

You finally make the bowl set down on the desk, with the fork in it. You smile, as you feel your power growing within you.

You turn your head and stare at the dresser which contains your clothing. The dresser drawer opens on its own, and a clean t-shirt, underwear and shorts float out from the drawers and they fly to your bed. The shirt and shorts you’re wearing slide off of your body without you even touching them with your hands!

Then, as you walk over to the bathroom, your clean clothes hover next to you. You feel your power increase at an exponential rate!

Finally, you stop at the window in the hallway. The lights flicker due to the raging thunderstorm outside. You raise the sliding window and glance outside for a moment. All you see are dark clouds, flashes of light, and the rumbles of thunder.

You just stare at the dark clouds and you imagine them just breaking up, clearing a hole in the sky so that you can see the bright moon and the stars. Then, just as you envision it in your mind, your wish actually comes true!

The clouds begin to break apart and the storm begins to leave! It takes only two minutes for the storm clouds to move in all four directions, clearing the sky so that you can now enjoy the bright moon and the stars overhead. Your jaw just drops open as you realize that you had actually caused the weather to change!

“No way…” you whisper. “Noooooo wayyy! Did I do that?”

You quickly close the window and continue to the bathroom, with your clothes floating right behind you. The shower doors slide open automatically and the bathroom door just closes on its own. You just grin as you realize that it your new powers don’t come with an on/off-switch. Now that you’re doing everything with your cool new telekinetic powers, you don’t know how to stop using them.

You take a quick shower, making the bar soap pass all over your body. The water turned on and off again, without you even touching any of the levers. And, finally, the bath towel just came off the rack on its own, rubbing against your wet body like it was a living object. You just stood there, with your arms hanging from the side, as the towel just dried you off. When you felt completely dried, the towel flew back and hung itself on the rack, like magic.

You clothes floated over to your body and they dressed you! Your body lifted three inches off the floor, so you could put on the underwear and shorts. Finally, the shirt came over your head and pulled over your torso.

You walked back to the bedroom, where you made a comic book fly off the bookcase. It opened up to the first page, as it hovered before your head. You had just started to read it, when you noticed that someone was standing in the door opening, looking at you in complete awe.

It was Sam…

You sat there, stunned at what had happened. Only a smile came across your face as you saw a ghostly image of your mother standing between you and the Stragoth. There was no doubt in your mind that it was her; she had made up her own style of martial arts and her stance was unique to all others. "Don't you dare touch my son!" Furious, she thundered.

She then turned to Sam as she pulled herself to her feet. "We are working on bridging the gap so we can bring our son home." Firmly, she said. "Any attempt to stop us will be perceived as a hostile act and will be met with a hostile response."

"With all due respect, madam; from what your son has told us, your world has nothing to defend itself against our foes." With equal firmness, Sam replied. "Attempting to enter this world may bring certain doom to your world."

Mom chuckled. "My son knows very little of our world." Bemused, she said. "He has not yet reached the age of reason." She then turned to you. "Hang on, sweetie." Cooing, she said. "Your father and I are working on getting you back home."

"Please hurry." Wincing, you said.

Mom turned as dad's voice was heard in the background. "We have to cut this short, Natasha." Disappointed, he said. "Their world is pulling out of range. We will have another chance when the orbits align again in about a week."

"A week?!" Frustrated, you wailed.

"I'll see you again in a week, honey." Wincing, mom said. "Stay strong. We will get you back home, that's a promise."

Mom's image then vanished from view. You reached your hand out to where she was, crying then gasped seeing the 'Max' look alike being dragged away by armed soldiers. Sam sighed, shaking her head as you slowly lowered your hand. "It looks like you were right about those spies." Softly, she said. "Your parents trying to get you home complicates things, though."

"Why?" Worried, you asked.

Sam shook her head. "Your mother was able to materialize here with only one stargate." Serious, she explained. "Can you imagine what the Lucian alliance can do with that kind of technological breakthrough?"

You do what she says, you make a fist and aim your arm at a patch of grass.

Suddenly, a plasma beam fires from your fist and lights the grass on fire!

"Whoa!"

"Eric! You see? You're a human WEAPON!" she adds. "You're powerful! You're no ordinary kid!"

You're completely astonished by your own show of power that you knew nothing about, but Tabitha knew that you possessed. Your mouth drops wide open...

"We need you, Eric... You're strong... You're powerful... You're our only hero..."

You let these words sink in...

"Come, let's fly around... I'm driving!" she says.

You hold her in your arms as you feel your powers working again... Your body lifts off and you carry yourself and Tabitha above the ground, and you two are soon soaring above the city...

145322121212.content:
You're flying around with Tabitha for a few minutes now, enjoying the cool wind blowing in your hair as you soar across the sky. True, you understand that you couldn't do this back home, where you were normal. It was rather nice having super powers. On the other hand, it wasn't nice having soldiers shoot at you all the time... like... now!

POW!

"Tabitha! What was that? I think I saw a bullet..." you say to her.

POW!

"Land! I have to land! Now!"you say as you take over and make you land on a patch of grass in the middle of a park."Somebody's shooting at us!"

"Eric! I'm scared!" she says as she begins to tremble.

You're really not feeling that scared anymore. You know that their bullets can't hurt you. But... What about HER? Then, you turn to face her. You realize that you can at least protect her for a little while.

You place your hands on her shoulders and a blue force field forms around her like a bubble.

"There! That should hold until the greatest danger is---"

POW! POW! POW!

You turn around. There are suddenly three... eight... twelve... No... Twenty soldiers running towards you, carrying rifles! Behind them, and to your left... to your right, and behind you... TANKS! Firing at YOU!

POW POW BAM BOOM BANG POW BOOM BANG RATTATATTA BAM BOOM!!!!

"ERIC!!!!!" Tabitha screams at you.

"You want me?" you shout at the soldiers and tanks. "Come and GET ME!"

You make your fists and point them at the approaching enemies. Your anger makes them fire plasma blasts at them, causing the first two tanks to blow up into amazing fire balls!

BUZZZZZZZZZ FLOOM!!!!

"Whhhhhhaaaaah!" the soldiers scream as their tanks blow up!

One by one you set their tanks on fire, using your plasma beams! Each explosion takes out a set of soldiers as well, and the force of the explosions set the grass and the trees on fire! The entire area is burning everywhere!

Finally, you turn around and grab hold of Tabitha. She is trembling, shaking, crying.

You take off, looking down in silence, as you leave behind a scene of total destruction. You know you're really wanted now. You just destroyed the army single-handedly. You're in deep trouble. All you wanted to do right now was hide...

info.description:
The Characters:

Eric Summers (You): Very shy but kind, you are very small and slender for your age of 13 (4' 0'') with gentle blue eyes and longish dust blond hair. You are often mistaken for a small girl, you have become used to it.

Tonya Summers: (Older sister): An out going, athletic tomboy (15) with wild green eyes and long auburn hair. She stands at a towering 6' and is very protective of you, trying to get you to become more out going. She often takes you with her when she goes out with her friends to keep you safe.

Maximilian Summers (Father): A 35 year old inventor/scientist with short dust blond hair and wild green eyes. He works for the government. building devices to 'benefit' man kind. He never used you to test his inventions but Tonya fears that he will, someday, be tempted. Her fears are realized.

Natasha Summers (Mother): A muscular 32 year old adventurer/explorer with long auburn hair and gentle blue eyes. She has a passion for risk and danger, she happily tests her husbands inventions for him. (thus your condition) She is constantly trying to make you more adventurous.

Bethany Lore (best friend): A feisty/energetic pistol of a girl (13) with long sun blond hair and piercing green eyes who loves you for your gentle nature and is determined to bring out your 'wild side'.

Trever 'the tank' Powers (Tonya's best friend): Strong and outgoing (15) with crew cut black hair and hazel eyes. He sees Eric as a 'little brother' and strives to make him stronger in hopes that he will grow because of it.

THE RULES:

1: New characters are welcome, this includes Anime characters as long as they go well with the previous chapter.

2: Do not kill the main character and have him work to find his way home unless you intend to have him somehow jump from world to world.

3: Try to change Eric's size only by perspective, ie: he is in a world of tiny people or a world of giants making him look like an infant by comparison. Making him younger or older works as well.

4: Eric's gender can change by what ever means but make it believable. ie: The energy of the portal does it to him, Bethany or Tonya is a witch, etc.

5. Eric can become fused with an object, pulled in with him but, again, make the reason how it happened believable.

That's it! Have fun!

The story begins as you accidentally walk into one of your father's experiments in the basement of your house...
